AI integration enabled us to develop solutions that reduce manual tasks, such as proposing accounting codes, thereby improving efficiency and user experience. We are committed to enabling our customers to utilize data and AI for their business needs, providing insights into cost management and business intelligence. For example, our AI and automated accounting module available for our professional customers transforms our software into a proactive and predictive tool for managing routine tasks. Our investments in data and AI are designed to achieve several key objectives: (i) collecting and measuring data to enhance our data platforms and governance; (ii) creating an AI platform to support new use cases with generative AI and machine learning; (iii) developing AI tools such as virtual assistants to support customer activities; and (iv) fostering a data-driven culture within our customers’ organizations to improve cross-business coordination. These initiatives are aimed at maintaining our competitive edge and delivering exceptional value to our customers. AI features enhance customer interaction and support through a virtual assistant, customer assistant AI tool, Invoice Insights, and banks-to-invoice matching, thereby improving efficiency and accuracy. These innovations position us as a leader in the integration of AI within ERP, providing our customers with unparalleled capabilities to streamline their operations and make data-driven decisions.

Subsection Title: Our strengths
Subsubsection Title: Well invested, leading SaaS platform, enabling product innovation and future growth
Subsubsection Text: Since our establishment in 1979, we have consistently adapted to technological advancements, evolving from onpremises solutions to a market-leading SaaS platform. In 2014, we became one of the first companies in Italy to invest in cloud products, which allowed us to gain a significant competitive advantage in the Italian business management software sector. By 2015, we started developing an integrated SaaS platform with extensive application programing interfaces and a strong emphasis on user experience (“UX”) and user interface design, positioning ourselves swiftly as a center of excellence. We believe that our SaaS platform excels through its comprehensive approach to cross-selling end-to-end digitalization services, benefiting from high-level services, such as Digital Finance, Trust Services, and marketing automation, shared across multiple customer segments to enhance value and efficiency. By incorporating lowlevel utilities shared across the platform and focusing on front-end/UX enhancements, workflow optimizations, dedicated modules, and end-to-end integration, we deliver a seamless and intuitive user experience. Additionally, a common data repository supports our integrated approach, ensuring data consistency, accuracy and accessibility. Cloud products accounted for 48.5% of our revenue for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, compared to ----- 40% in the year ended December 31, 2021. As of March 31, 2024, we had successfully transitioned approximately 92% of our customers to at least one cloud solution, underscoring our leadership in the sector. Our platform integrates advanced analytics and AI to drive growth and differentiation. We use data-driven approaches to enhance operations and products and automating and reducing manual tasks. Our AI investments focus on creating an AI platform for generative AI and machine learning, developing tools like virtual assistants, enhancing data platforms and governance, and fostering a data-driven culture for better cross-business coordination. Our ongoing investments in research and development (“R&D”), contributing to our continuous growth, are crucial for transforming our products to meet the diverse needs of our large and diversified customer base and increasing our recurring revenue through regular upgrades and price adjustments. In particular, between 2020 and 2023, we invested an average of €60 million per year in R&D activities, excluding cloud and infrastructure costs. As of March 31, 2024, our commitment to innovation was supported by approximately 1,200 software engineers managing over 100 million lines of code. We believe that our consistent focus on innovation, as exemplified by our advanced and continuously evolving SaaS platform, positions us well for continued growth and differentiation.

Subsection Title: Our strengths
Subsubsection Title: Large, highly diversified and fragmented customer base characterized by high retention rates
Subsubsection Text: From 2015 to 2023, our end customer base, excluding VARs’ end customers, increased at a CAGR of 30.8%, growing from approximately 200,000 customers to approximately 2,105,000 customers, of which 1,850,000 were micro and small businesses, 80,000 were professionals and 180,000 were mid-market businesses. Our Net Revenue Retention rate reached 106% as of December 31, 2023, demonstrating our ability to drive organic revenue growth within our existing customer base. This strong retention rate highlights the value and effectiveness of our solutions, fostering long-term customer loyalty and consistent revenue growth. We believe these results underscore the exceptional value and satisfaction our customers derive from our products and services, as well as our ability to drive top-line revenue growth from our existing customers. Our customer base is large, diversified and fragmented, which mitigates risks related to declines in product demand in any one particular industry and reduces reliance on revenues from a small number of key customers. For the year ended December 31, 2023, our ten largest customers generated 5.0% of our total revenue, while our 50 largest customers and 200 largest customers generated 10.4% and 15.3%, respectively, over the same period. We also do not have any major single industry exposure, while keeping a significant contribution from resilient sectors and low exposure to industries typically more affected by macroeconomic disruptions (e.g., restaurants, bars and catering, hospitality, tour operators and travel agencies). The chart below sets forth our current customer concentration by sectors for the year ended December 31, 2023.

Subsection Title: Customers breakdown by industry** **(%)
Subsubsection Text: _Source: Management analysis._ ----- (1) Excludes approximately 8% of “Other industries”, which includes, amongst others, transport, agriculture, education and other industries. Our commitment to delivering exceptional products and services is reflected in our consistently high Net Promoter Score (“NPS”) across all industries in which we operate. NPS, a metric used to calculate customer satisfaction, represents the percentage of customers rating their likelihood to recommend our products to others. It is measured as the sum of the percentage of promoters (loyal customers, repeat buyers, and those most likely to promote our business willingly) less the percentage of detractors (customers unlikely to buy our products again). Our high NPS indicates that our products not only generate high customer satisfaction but also maintain such satisfaction consistently across diverse sectors. Our NPS also demonstrates the universal appeal and reliability of our offerings. This level of customer advocacy also contributes to our sustained growth and competitive advantage, highlighting that our products resonate well with a wide range of customers and industry needs. The table below shows our growing NPS levels from the last quarter of the year ended December 31, 2022 to the last quarter of the year ended December 31, 2023. _Source: Nielsen._ We have historically experienced high and stable Customer Retention Rates. For the years ended December 31, 2021, 2022 and 2023, we have experienced high and stable Customer Retention Rates of approximately (i) 90.3%, 90.0% and 90.7, respectively, for micro and small business customers; (ii) 90.7%, 92.5% and 91.8%, respectively, for mid-market business customers; and (iii) 91.7%, 93% and 92.8%, respectively, for professionals. Customer Retention Rate for micro and small businesses customers is typically slightly lower than Customer Retention Rate for mid-market customers and professionals due to the lower switching costs associated with solutions for micro and small business, mainly as a result of their lower level of complexity, and frequent business lifecycle changes within this segment. We believe that the mission-critical nature of our software products and services, which are deeply embedded in many of our customers’ workflows and IT systems, has historically provided a degree of insulation from economic uncertainties and resulted in our high Customer Retention Rates. Our customers’ operations depend upon our products to facilitate data flow, not only in-house, with respect to internal business management data analysis and storage, but also externally, between our customers and other businesses or between our customers, banks, tax authorities and other public administration organizations. In addition, our high Customer Retention Rate is also supported by our customers’ satisfaction and overall willingness to renew their subscriptions. In particular, mid-market and professional customers tend to carefully consider the migration to alternative software providers in light of, among others,: (i) the mission-critical nature of software and the possibility that customers may be exposed to data migration risk during a transition to an alternative supplier; (ii) the cost and length of time required to transition to an alternative platform given that ERP systems are integral to the various operational segments of an organization; and (iii) the training required to familiarize employees with new software. Moreover, for the professionals customer segment, we believe the adoption of our digital ancillary solutions allows a strong connection and digital interrelation between our professional customers and their endcustomers, making our professional customers more dependent on our products in their day-to-day activities, which, in turn, incentivizes our customers to continue using our products and not to switch to competitors’ solutions. Our NPS for each of our Professional, Enterprise Solutions, Market Specific Solutions and Micro Solutions business units has shown a positive trend over the last four years. This positive trend, as illustrated in the chart below, underscores our ability to consistently deliver value and satisfaction to our customers, further solidifying our position as a leader in Italy. -----

Subsection Title: NPS Evolution
Subsubsection Text: _Source: Nielsen._ (1) “Professional” includes Italian customers of our Professional business unit. (2) “Enterprise” includes Italian customers of our Enterprise Solutions business unit. (3) “Micro” includes Italian micro and small customers. The charts below illustrate the absence of significant change in customer churn for each of the micro and small businesses, mid-market businesses, and professionals customer segments despite nominal price increases driven by price increases in most recent years:

Subsection Title: Nominal price increase** **Churn [(1)]
Subsubsection Title: Best-in-class business model and financial profile, with predictable and resilient organic revenue growth, increasing profitability with strong cashflow conversion
Subsubsection Text: We have achieved remarkable growth over the past 15 years with strong acceleration after 2000. In particular, between the year ended December 31, 2021, and the year ended December 31, 2023, our organic total revenue, calculated as our total revenue less the revenue from acquired companies, grew at an average annual rate of 10.0%. Moreover, our performance has consistently outpaced the Italian GDP growth, even during challenging economic periods such as the 2009 and 2012 financial crises and the COVID-19 pandemic. In 2012, amidst the global financial crisis, Italy’s GDP declined by 2.8%, while we achieved organic revenue growth of 1.7%, outperforming the Italian GDP by 4.5 percentage points. Similarly, in 2020, when the Italian GDP declined compared to 2019, we achieved 7.3% organic revenue growth, outperforming the Italian GDP by 16.0 percentage points, mainly due to the successful launch of our e-invoicing products and the strong demand for these solutions underpinned by COVID-19 dynamics. In 2022 and 2023, we outperformed the Italian GDP by 5.9% and 10.9%, respectively, underscoring our continuous and outstanding growth across adverse economic cycles. The following chart presents a comparison of our organic revenue growth and the Italian GDP growth for each year between 2009 and 2023:

Subsection Title: Nominal price increase** **Churn [(1)]
Subsubsection Text: _Source: Management analysis._ (1) Churn, including downgrades, have been allocated from our business units to our customer segments according to products and subdivisions of our business units. The analysis excludes (i) Digital Finance, hardware and other and (ii) Extended CRM and international operations. -----

Subsection Title: TeamSystem Group Organic Revenue Growth (YoY %)[1 ]
Subsubsection Title: Successful and disciplined bolt-on M&A strategy, with proven playbook of acquiring high quality, accretive opportunities
Subsubsection Text: Our historical acquisition strategy has successfully enabled us to expand our business across customers, segments, geographic areas and product offerings. Our proven integration playbook has consistently enabled us to achieve revenue and cost synergies, in the form of cross-selling and upselling for the former and in the form of workforce and real estate rationalization, procurement centralization and other product (for example, the use of Group ----- developer pool, architecture and UX) synergies for the latter. We have been able to achieve for the cohorts acquired between 2011 and 2023 an average revenue CAGR between 15% and 20% and an EBITDA margin expansion between 14 and 16 percentage points, in each case post acquisition. The main goals we have pursued with the latest acquisitions, and intend to continue pursuing, relate to the following main areas: - _product and capabilities enhancement: we have strategically acquired selected startups, software houses, and individual business units to enhance our opportunity to cross-sell and expand our presence in the segments served by these entities; these acquisitions aim at reducing our time-to-market for the launch of new cloud-based and industry specific solutions, providing us with an advantage over our competitors and allowing us to internalize relevant competences and expertise on innovative technologies and products (e.g., solutions for e-mail and SMS marketing as well as technical software for the construction and engineering sectors); - _international expansion: in recent years, we have completed several acquisitions to expand our footprint outside of Italy. This includes selected acquisitions in Spain, where new e-invoicing regulations are expected to be gradually implemented in the coming years, and we anticipate strong digitalization trends and growth potential, particularly in the micro and small business customer segment. Additionally, we have acquired a leading player in Turkey, a geographic area which comprises over 3 million enterprises with high growth and digitalization potential; and - _VARs insourcing: we have acquired and we intend to continue acquiring our VARs. By doing so, we aim to establish strong and direct relationships with our customers, further support our upselling initiatives and continue their transition to cloud solutions. We have a dedicated team focused on the integration of acquired companies and we have developed a disciplined and structured approach to plan and execute all activities required to successfully integrate and extract revenue and cost synergies from acquired companies. In particular, the integration process involves all aspects of the acquired businesses, including finance, cybersecurity, compliance, data protection, reporting, personnel, procurement, facility management, R&D, product integration, marketing and sales and the definition of the value proposition and go-to-market approach for the newly acquired and integrated products. We have made a number of selected and, we believe, highly strategic bolt-on acquisitions over the past few years which we believe have contributed to our success. In particular, over the years, we have developed a structured process to integrate the acquired entities through a well-developed process which spans from three to 24 months, depending on the features and complexities of the deal. Between 2021 and 2022 we have been able to successfully complete a series of bolt-on acquisitions which allowed us to expand and consolidate our presence in terms of product offering and geography. In 2023, we further expanded our portfolio with key acquisitions, including MailUp, a marketing automation platform, and GreeNext, a software developer for waste management. Additionally, we strengthened our presence in Spain by acquiring Acumbamail and Aplifisa, and entered Turkey by acquiring the Mikro group, enhancing our offerings in marketing, accounting, and ERP solutions. Furthermore, we believe that the acquisitions we made have generated revenue synergies. Such acquisitions gave us, for example, the ability to increase our brand recognition internationally, cross-sell and up-sell the products that we acquired to our existing customer base and to enrich our product offering in key strategic areas (e.g., marketing automation with Mail-Up, e-commerce with Storeden, GreenNext for waste management solutions and Beneficy Welfare to enrich our HR platform).

Subsection Title: TeamSystem Group Organic Revenue Growth (YoY %)[1 ]
Subsubsection Title: Strong focus on sustainability initiatives to reduce our environmental impact, supporting our people while ensuring a sustainable governance model
Subsubsection Text: We are committed to continuous improvement and operational excellence, with a focus on sustainability, employee well-being, and robust governance practices. We are dedicated to achieving ambitious environmental targets, including carbon neutrality by 2025 and net zero emissions by 2030. This commitment is reflected in our efforts to transition our datacenter towards green computational capacity by benefitting from advanced software and digitalization techniques to significantly reduce emissions. Our initiatives also include facilitating access to compensation mechanisms and implementing carbon offsetting projects, such as direct investments in local reforestation efforts. Furthermore, we are committed to reducing our office footprint through digitalization, including paper-use reduction via e-invoicing solutions, and transitioning our fleet to full electric and hybrid vehicles. Our environmental focus extends to our customers, suppliers and communities. By benefitting from our software and digitalization capabilities, we aim to facilitate ----- their sustainable transition to more eco-friendly operations. Additionally, we offer waste-compliant solutions for companies to digitize business management, automate processes, and manage critical factors without crossplatform integration issues. In the social realm, we are deeply committed to diversity and inclusion as well as employee well-being and development. Our initiatives focus on promoting gender diversity and empowering young graduates. We have implemented a broad program for new ways of working, including working from home and “Light Fridays,” and offer a comprehensive welfare program for employees and their families, which includes online psychological counseling services and periodic training courses. Our diversity and inclusion efforts are supported by a KPI dashboard that tracks metrics such as new hires, re-hires, and promotions. Furthermore, we engage in early STEM education through school orientation activities and employer branding communication campaigns. We also support the development of our employees through comprehensive training and well-being programs, while adopting a sustainable governance and business model to ensure long-term success. In addition to our internal focus, our value proposition also includes solutions targeting the non-profit sector, such as member management, courses, summer camps, dues, and accounting. Our governance strategy is underpinned by a dedicated committee on ESG and risk management, non-financial reporting, and external certifications such as ESG ratings and B-Corp. We have established robust policies and compliance measures, including whistleblowing, anti-bribery, ethical codes, and data protection standards (ISDP 10003, ISO27001). Our dedicated cybersecurity team, led by our Head of Cybersecurity and Compliance, is critical to our commitment to ensure compliance with the highest standards of data protection and security. We believe our commitment to sustainability, social responsibility, and robust governance not only enhances our competitive position but also ensures we contribute positively to the environment and society.

Subsection Title: TeamSystem Group Organic Revenue Growth (YoY %)[1 ]
Subsubsection Title: Experienced management team with a proven track record in delivering growth and profitability
Subsubsection Text: We are managed by a strong executive team, which comprises individuals with many years of relevant experience and provides leadership across all functional areas of our business. Our management team includes members who benefit from experience in leading international groups, members who have been with us for more than ten years and who have developed a strong knowledge of the industry, and high-performing talents with experience in leading international consultancy firms. Our management team has demonstrated its ability to grow our business and improve operating performance, as evidenced by the increase in our revenues and Adjusted EBITDA over a long period, including in the face of global economic downturns and economic instability. Due to our effective retention and incentive mechanisms, we have maintained stability in our top management, ensuring continuity and consistency in our leadership. We believe the industry knowledge and leadership of our management team, combined with their long-term experience and strong execution capabilities, provide us with a significant competitive advantage. We also benefit from the strong expertise in the software industry and the long-term commitment of our principal shareholder, H&F. Since 2016, H&F has implemented successful value creation initiatives and demonstrated a strong partnership with our management team, driving our business internationally. We believe that our shareholders have high conviction in the business with outstanding organic growth opportunities and strong competitive positioning. We believe that our current management team and ownership structure will allow us to continue to attract and retain the industry’s top talent, further driving sustainable profitable growth.

Subsection Title: TeamSystem Group Organic Revenue Growth (YoY %)[1 ]
Subsubsection Text: _Source: IMF –World Economic Outlook Database; Management analysis._ (1) The organic growth is based on managerial accounts; statutory organic growth for the year ended December 31, 2021, 2022 and 2023 was 6.7%, 10.5% and 13.7%, respectively. Our resilience is evidenced by a consistent pattern of organic revenue growth since 2009, even during periods of economic turbulence. We believe such sustained growth is attributable to several key factors: (i) the recurring nature of our contracts; (ii) our customers’ loyalty, as demonstrated by our high NPS and low churn rates; (iii) the mission-critical nature of our software, our broad, rich and fully integrated product suite, which makes customers, particularly SMEs and professional clients, reluctant to switch to alternative suppliers due to the time-consuming migration process, allowing us to maintain sales even during economic downturns; and (iv) our strong brand recognition. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, we generated 83.5% of our total revenue from recurring sources (compared to 81.6% in 2021), which we believe provides significant visibility of future earnings. In particular, in the three-month period ended March 31, 2024 our recurring revenue accounted for 86.5% of our total revenue underscoring our stability and predictability from the first months of each calendar year. The growth in the contribution of revenues with a recurring nature to our total revenue has been driven in part by the increased weight and importance of our cloud solutions in our product portfolio, with the contribution of cloud software solutions revenue to our total revenue increasing from 39.8% in 2021 to 48.5% for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024. In addition, our profitability and cash flow generation have also shown significant improvement. Our Adjusted EBITDA grew from €170.1 million (€199.7 million on a pro forma basis to give effect the 2021 Acquisition as if it had occurred on January 1, 2021) in 2021 to €227.3 million in 2022, €313.8 million in 2023, and €334.9 million for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, respectively. As a result, our Adjusted EBITDA margin grew from ----- 41.4% in 2021 (40.8% on a pro forma basis to give effect the 2021 Acquisition as if it had occurred on January 1, 2021) to 43.0% for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024. We believe there is a correlation between margins and shares in our reference sectors, therefore, we see strong upside potential as we consolidate our multi-platform offerings. Furthermore, our invoicing strategy enhances our financial stability by invoicing our customers in advance at the beginning of each calendar year during our annual budgeting process. Additionally, most of our contracts are typically renewed unless customers provide a written termination notice prior to expiration. This approach gives us strong visibility over our cash flows and capital requirements, allowing us to carefully plan our capital needs and ensuring consistent and regular revenue streams. We believe that our billing pattern contributes to the overall visibility of our cash flows and ensures substantial liquidity. With over 70% of invoices issued between fourth quarter of each calendar year and the first quarter of the subsequent calendar year, we secure significant cash-in contributions in the first half of the year, effectively covering our cash needs, with about 30% of invoices issued during the second and third quarter of the year, primarily for prepaid cloud products for micro and small businesses. Approximately 35% of our invoices are issued in January and 50% by March, providing us with the liquidity needed for the rest of the year. Year-end invoicing for our In Cloud products, sold on annual subscription models, further enhances cash flow predictability. We believe that this invoicing strategy enables us to effectively predict and monitor our revenue and cash flow levels, ensuring strong liquidity and contributing to our financial stability and operational efficiency. As a result, we maintain a robust Operating Free Cash Flow, which further supports our financial health and strategic initiatives. The following chart shows the evolution of our Operating Free Cash Flow for each calendar month of the year ended December 31, 2023. _Source: Management analysis._ (1) “OCF” means operating free cash flow. (2) “OCF YtD” refers to the aggregate operating free cash flow from January 1, 2023 to the applicable month of the year ended December 31, 2023.

Subsection Title: Our strategy
Subsubsection Title: Continue growing our customer base by benefitting from untapped opportunities in the international segments
Subsubsection Text: We believe that we are best positioned to leverage our broad product platform and capitalize on favorable regulatory tailwinds to continue growing our customer base in the international segments. We intend to continue consolidating our presence in Spain and Turkey while exploring further expansion opportunities, including other European countries. The Spanish ERP sector presents significant growth opportunities. Spain currently lags slightly behind the European average in terms of digitalization, with publicly available data indicating that only approximately onethird of enterprises have adopted cloud solutions. We aim to capitalize on this substantial growth potential by expanding our presence and establishing ourselves as the preferred provider for businesses transitioning to digital business management by, among others, offering comprehensive cloud solutions alongside user-friendly einvoicing systems. Similar to the Italian ERP sector, we believe that favorable regulatory trends in Spain, including mandatory e-invoicing, will facilitate further sector expansion. In particular, the mandatory e-invoicing regulations in Spain, expected to be implemented between 2025 and 2027, present a significant opportunity for growth and expansion. This regulatory change is anticipated to unlock substantial potential, benefitting from an estimated 3.4 million of addressable customers, of which 3.3 million micro businesses and 0.1 million SMEs as of December 31, 2023. The implementation will follow a specific timeline based on a turnover threshold of €8 million, requiring legal entities and sole traders above this threshold to issue and receive e-invoices. We believe this regulatory shift will facilitate the adoption of our comprehensive cloud solutions and user-friendly e-invoicing systems by offering tailored solutions for businesses transitioning to digital business management. ----- In Turkey, the mandatory adoption of e-invoicing, driven by inflation and efforts to address the shadow economy, presents another growth opportunity for us to cater to an estimated 3.8 million of addressable customers, of which 3.5 million micro businesses and 0.3 million SMEs as of December 31, 2023. The expansion of e-invoicing compliance, expected to be implemented between 2023 and 2027, will require e-invoicing for companies with a turnover of 3 million Turkish lira. Approximately 800,000 businesses are expected to fall within the regulation by 2025, with more than 1 million by 2027 due to inflation. This regulatory change is likely to drive micro businesses toward ERP adoption, improving our overall segment penetration. By offering compliant and efficient e-invoicing solutions, we aim to help Turkish businesses navigate the regulatory landscape and enhance their financial management, replicating our successful strategy from Italy.

Subsection Title: Our strategy
Subsubsection Title: Continue benefitting from our large customer base to facilitate growth of our innovative cross-segment product suite
Subsubsection Text: Benefitting from our large and diversified customer base, we aim to facilitate the growth of our innovative crosssegment product suite. By focusing on Digital Finance, HR, Extended CRM and Trust solutions, we benefit from significant cross-selling opportunities across both our Italian and international segments. We believe that integrating these advanced tools with our existing ERP and FMS software provides a seamless and efficient business management ecosystem. Our product offerings are highly customizable and have been developed both internally and through strategic acquisitions. We have integrated these offerings into our ERP and FMS product suite, tailoring them to serve our three target customer segments: micro businesses, mid-market businesses and professionals. By defining specific go-to-market strategies for each customer segment, we believe we have been able, and will continue, to grow efficiently and effectively. Our Digital Finance products offer value-added services that streamline financial operations and improve cash flow management. Our HR Solutions, fully integrated with our ERP and FMS software, ensure a seamless experience that enhances operational efficiency and data consistency. We believe that these solutions cater to the diverse needs of our customer base, driving further adoption and satisfaction. Extended CRM provides tools for relationship management, marketing automation, and e-commerce integration, helping businesses scale operations and enhance customer engagement. Trust Services enable secure, compliant digital operations through digital signatures, archiving, and SPID access. By integrating with our ERP and FMS software, these services ensure streamlined operations and data consistency, providing customers with the tools needed to operate securely and efficiently in a digital environment. We believe cross-selling these solutions to our Italian and international customer base will allow us to benefit from our competitive presence and customer relationships, enabling our customers to fully benefit from a fully integrated business management platform. This comprehensive range of interconnected solutions is expected to enhance customer satisfaction and retention, thereby maximizing customer lifetime value.

Subsection Title: Our strategy
Subsubsection Title: Capture upselling opportunities within our existing customer base, particularly among our micro business customers, by repositioning customers toward software packages with more advanced features
Subsubsection Text: Since 2014, we have consistently advanced our cloud-based solutions, benefitting from strong digitalization trends and capitalizing on new regulatory obligations, such as Italian e-invoicing regulations, requiring new or updated software. Our focus on the micro business customer segment has enabled us to secure a leading position in this segment by offering user-friendly e-invoicing solutions. These solutions are available in various packages with additional functionalities and price tiers tailored to the specific needs of clients, such as Fatture in Cloud “Standard,” Fatture in Cloud “Premium,” Fatture in Cloud “Premium Plus,” and Fatture in Cloud “Complete.” Moving forward, we plan to capitalize on upselling opportunities within our existing customer base, particularly among our micro business customers, by transitioning them to premium versions of our software with more advanced features, such as the “Premium,” “Premium Plus,” and “Complete” tiers of our Fatture in Cloud software. To support this upselling strategy, we plan to introduce integrated and comprehensive solutions that capitalize on our strong relationships with accountant customers to facilitate and promote migration from our TeamSystem Digital platform, which generates on average an ARPU ranging from €10 to €20 per year, to higher-ARPU generating solutions, such as Fatture in Cloud and Contabilità in Cloud solutions, which generate on average an ARPU ranging from €140 to €500 per year. Currently, we provide tailored packages of our cloud-based solutions, such as Digital Invoice and Fatture in Cloud, to our accountant customers, who resell these to their clients. In the future, we plan to continue offering tailored packages while also supporting our accountant customers in digitizing ----- their internal processes and relationships with end-customers through premium software. To support this reposition, we expect to further develop our Fatture in Cloud suite for micro business customers by progressively adding advanced functionalities and features to boost upselling activity, such as dashboards for integrated client management. These solutions will simplify and automate data exchange and basic tax and accounting activities through our cloud products and enable end-customers of accountants to focus on higher value-added services. We believe these initiatives will, in turn, help accountants build loyalty with their clients and strengthen their dependence on our platforms at higher subscription fees.

Subsection Title: Our strategy
Subsubsection Title: Benefitting from AI and data to enhance customer service, optimize business operations and deliver smarter, AI-driven products
Subsubsection Text: We have developed a comprehensive strategy to benefit from AI and data as pivotal drivers for our growth and differentiation. As of March 31, 2024, approximately 700 thousand of our customers used at least one of our products with an embedded AI feature. We plan to develop a multi-AI platform to govern services and create cross-synergies, offering AI-based products and services such as virtual assistants and self-service business intelligence tools. We also expect our AI platform to support new AI use cases, enabling us to redesign internal processes, reduce manual tasks as well as provide valuable insights to our customers. We also intend to collect, catalogue and measure data from our main products, ensuring all domains are integrated into a comprehensive data platform. By implementing robust data governance, we plan to enhance customer experience, product offerings and business operations. We also intend to support data monetization by selling aggregated and benchmarked data to customers and third parties. We intend to focus on developing AI and data-driven features across all key products, including customer assistant tools, machine learning accounting and business insights. Our initiatives are expected to improve data infrastructure and services, providing a new way to access and understand data. By coordinating cross-business unit projects and fostering an internal AI and data culture, we aim to be recognized as a key data player in the industry. Our strategy includes a people-driven approach to AI, ensuring that our employees are equipped with the necessary skills and knowledge to benefit from data as an asset. We intend to continue building awareness and promoting a culture of AI and data both internally and externally, positioning ourselves as leaders in the field. By integrating AI and data into our operations, we expect to improve how we serve our customers and run our business. This will enable us to offer smarter, AI-based and data-driven products that meet the evolving needs of our customers. Our commitment to adopting AI and data is expected to drive innovation, efficiency and growth, ensuring we remain at the forefront of our industry.

Subsection Title: Our strategy
Subsubsection Text: Since 2021, we have focused on the digitalization of our customer base, rationalizing our sales model and strengthening customer retention and satisfaction. Additionally, we have focused on expanding our horizontal solutions to drive upselling and cross-selling opportunities. This strategic emphasis has enabled us to better meet diverse customer needs and enhance our value proposition. Our internationalization efforts have also been pivotal, expanding our presence beyond Italy and capturing new opportunities, which now account for a growing share of our revenue. To support this expansion and our broader growth objectives, we have revised our organizational structure, aligning it more closely with our strategic priorities and improving operational efficiency. As a result of these strategic focuses, we have achieved remarkable growth and transformation, doubling in scale and enhancing our business diversification and quality, with a significant acceleration in value creation. _Business scale: Since 2020, we have made significant progress across multiple dimensions of our business. Our_ total revenue has increased at a CAGR of 20.2% from €422.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2020, to €778.7 million for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, with average organic growth over the same period ----- reaching 10%. As part of this overall growth, our international operations have also shown significant expansion. Our adjusted EBITDA has also seen substantial growth, from €181.2 million to €313.8 million over the same period. Additionally, our customer base expanded from 1.6 million as of the year ended December 31, 2021 to 2.1 million as of the year ended December 31, 2023, driven by new client acquisitions, particularly among micro and small businesses adopting mandatory e-invoicing, and international growth in Spain and Turkey, which accounted for approximately 300 thousand customers as of December 31, 2023. _Business Mix and Geographic Diversification: We have accelerated our business diversification both_ geographically and in terms of our business mix. In 2020, we only generated revenues in Italy, whereas for the three months ended March 31, 2024, our international expansions grew at a faster pace than our domestic revenue and accounted for approximately 10% of our total revenue for such period. Additionally, our revenue mix has also evolved significantly since 2020, with the micro and small customer segment representing approximately 27.0% of our total revenues for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024 in acceleration representing 31% of our total revenues for the three-month period ended December 31, 2024, increasing from 18% for the year ended December 31, 2020. We have also increased our focus on cross-selling platforms such as HR, Extended CRM and Trust Services, bolstered by strategic acquisitions which have generated 7% of our total revenues for twelve months ended March 31, 2024. _Business Quality: Our business quality has significantly improved, with recurring revenues increasing from 79.7%_ for the year ended December 31, 2020 to 83.5% for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, and cloud revenues rising from 38% of our total revenue for the year ended December 31, 2020 to 49.9% of our total revenue for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024. Since 2021, our customer retention rates and NPS have both improved, with churn levels decreasing across segments despite price increases, and NPS increasing from 36 as of December 31, 2020 to 55 as of December 31, 2023. As a result of the above, the growth in our organic annualized recurring revenues (“ARR”) (representing the annual subscription fees in respect of our subscription agreements relating to certain key products that were in place as of a certain date, net of all subscription fees associated with churning customers who delivered termination notices on or prior to such date) amounted to approximately 10% in 2020, 12% in 2021, 12% in 2022 and 14% in 2023 (with a Net Retention Rate of 105.5%, 104.5%, 107.9% and 106.3% for the same periods). We now plan to continue further consolidating these trends to achieve long-term sustainable growth and strengthen our leadership in our core reference segments by: (i) selectively expanding our customer base; (ii) growing topline revenue by benefitting from upselling and cross-selling opportunities within our large and diversified customer base; and (iii) further improving our sales model while enhancing customer satisfaction and retention rates. Additionally, we aim to fully integrate data analysis and AI into our operations and product suites, enhance our offerings with the launch of SaaS-only products developed under the “One Platform” concept, and continue our commitment to sustainability. We intend to achieve these goals by pursuing the following strategies:

Subsection Title: Principal shareholders
Subsubsection Text: The Issuer is indirectly controlled by H&F Corporate Investors IX, Ltd, the ultimate general partner of Fund IX and certain Samson Brunello holdings. Hellman & Friedman is a preeminent global private equity firm with a distinctive investment approach focused on a limited number of large-scale equity investments in high-quality growth businesses. H&F seeks to partner with world-class management teams where its deep sector expertise, long-term orientation, and collaborative partnership approach enable companies to flourish. H&F targets outstanding businesses in select sectors, including technology, financial services, healthcare, consumer services & retail, and information, content & business services. Since its founding in 1984, H&F has made 25 investments in the technology sector, including Applied Systems (a U.S. based provider of insurance software), Genesys (a U.S. based provider of customer engagement software to large enterprises), IRIS (a U.K. based provider of industry specific software solutions to accountancy practices, law firms and not for profit organizations), Kronos (a U.S. based provider of human capital management software and services) and Ultimate Software (a U.S. based provider of cloud based human capital management and employee experience solutions), with Kronos and Ultimate Software having since been merged to form UKG. _As of the date of this Offering Memorandum, H&F Corporate Investors IX, Ltd indirectly controls 63.72% of the share capital of the Issuer, with the remaining part being indirectly held by Silver Lake (12.37%), Hg (5.45%), Luxinva (9.87%), CapitalG (2.78%) and certain management investors (5.81%). For further information, see “Principal shareholders.” See also “—Recent developments—H&F’s increased shareholding in the TeamSystem Group.”_ -----

Subsection Title: The Issuer
Subsubsection Text: The Issuer is a joint stock company (società per azioni) incorporated under the laws of Italy and registered under number 01035310414, REA PS-103483 with the Companies’ Register of Pesaro and Urbino. The Issuer’s registered office is located at Via Sandro Pertini 88, Pesaro (PU), Italy and its telephone number is +39 0721 42661.

Subsection Title: The Transactions
Subsubsection Text: We expect to use a portion of the cash proceeds from the Offering to (i) refinance €395.0 million of our existing senior secured indebtedness, including all outstanding Existing 2022 Private Notes, all outstanding Existing 2023 Private Notes, and all drawn amounts under the Revolving Credit Facility Agreement (without a corresponding cancellation of commitments thereunder), (ii) finance certain bolt-acquisitions and/or refinance any acquired debt or debt raised by the Issuer or its subsidiaries for such purposes, (iii) pay contingent deferred consideration and contingent liabilities relating to certain acquisitions (iv) fund cash on the Issuer’s balance sheet for general corporate purposes and (v) pay accrued and unpaid interest on the indebtedness to be refinanced and costs, fees, expenses and taxes in connection with the Transactions and any such financing, refinancing and/or acquisitions. In particular, we currently expect to redeem (i) all outstanding Existing 2022 Private Notes at a price of 100% of the aggregate principal amount thereof, and (ii) all outstanding Existing 2023 Private Notes at a price of 101% of the aggregate principal amount thereof, in each case plus accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the respective date of redemption, and additional amounts, if any. We expect that the Existing 2022 Private Notes will be redeemed on or about the Issue Date and that the Existing 2023 Private Notes will be redeemed on or after October 5, 2024. We also currently expect to repay all drawn amounts under the Revolving Credit Facility as of the Issue Date (without a corresponding cancellation of commitments thereunder), for an amount of approximately €15.0 million, using a portion of the cash proceeds from the Offering. In connection with the Refinancing, we expect to upsize the total commitments under the Revolving Credit Facility from €180.0 million to approximately €300.0 million pursuant to the Revolving Credit Facility Amendment and Restatement Agreement. See “—Revolving Credit _Facility Amendment.”_ In addition, we expect to use approximately €213 million of the cash proceeds from the Offering to (A) acquire, directly or indirectly (including by refinancing (i) debt we raised for such purposes or (ii) acquired debt we plan not to maintain outstanding following the relevant acquisitions), the entire share capital and/or majority shareholdings in businesses pursuant to our M&A strategy or shares in certain of our subsidiaries which are currently held by the minority shareholders thereof, thereby extinguishing the corresponding portion of the Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries which, as of March 31, 2024, on a discounted basis, was equal to €189.2 million and (B) pay deferred consideration and/or earn outs in connection with some of our bolt-on acquisitions. Lastly, we expect to use the remaining portion of the proceeds from the Offering to fund cash on the Issuer’s balance sheet for general corporate purposes, including to pay costs, fees, expenses and taxes in connection with the Transactions. We refer to the Offering and the application of the proceeds thereof, including the above mentioned transactions, collectively, as the “Refinancing.” For further information, see “Use of proceeds,” “Capitalization,” “Description _of Certain Financing Arrangements” and “Description of Notes.”_

Subsection Title: The Transactions
Subsubsection Text: To further support our liquidity and align the size of the Revolving Credit Facility with the growth of our business, on or prior to the Issue Date and subject to completion of the Offering and the satisfaction of customary conditions precedent, certain lenders including certain of the existing lenders and one or more new lenders are expected to participate in an upsize of the total commitments under the Revolving Credit Facility from €180.0 million to approximately €300.0 million by way of an amendment (the “Revolving Credit Facility Amendment”) pursuant to the Revolving Credit Facility Amendment and Restatement Agreement. As part of the Revolving Credit Facility Amendment, the maturity of the Revolving Credit Facility is expected to be extended to mature on the earlier of (x) January 31, 2031 and (y) the date falling six months prior to the maturity date of the Notes (such earlier date being, the “RCF Maturity Date”), provided that, to the extent that more than €200.0 million of the Existing ----- Senior Secured Notes remain outstanding as at the date falling six months prior to February 15, 2028 (such date being the “First Existing Senior Secured Notes Maturity Date”), the RCF Maturity Date shall be adjusted at such time to be the date falling three months prior to the First Existing Senior Notes Maturity Date, and subject to certain exceptions, the incurrence covenants and related definitions will be amended on or about the Issue Date to align to the equivalent covenants and definitions of the Notes (to the extent applicable) as will be set out in the Indenture.

Subsection Title: The Transactions
Subsubsection Title: Refinancing of the Existing PIK Notes
Subsubsection Text: On February 17, 2021, Holdco 3 issued €300.0 million of Senior Floating Rate Pay-If-You-Want PIK Toggle Notes due 2029 (the “Existing PIK Notes”) in a private placement. The Existing PIK Notes are an unguaranteed senior obligation of Holdco 3, and are secured, among others, on a contractual second-priority basis for the benefit of the holders of the Existing PIK Notes by 100% of the share capital of the Issuer held by Holdco 3. Interest on the Existing PIK Notes is payable either in cash or in kind or in a combination thereof, at the sole option of Holdco 3, in accordance with applicable provisions of law and the terms and conditions of the Existing PIK Notes. As of the date of this Offering Memorandum, the aggregate principal amount outstanding under the Existing PIK Notes corresponds to the amount of the Existing PIK Notes as originally issued. As of the date hereof, Holdco 3 has obtained written commitments from certain investors to purchase, by way of a private placement and subject to the satisfaction of certain customary conditions, €300.0 million aggregate principal amount of Senior Floating Rate Pay-If-You-Want PIK Toggle Notes due 2032 (the “PIK Notes”). The issue date of the PIK Notes is expected to occur on or prior to December 31, 2024 and the proceeds of the New PIK Notes are expected to be used by Holdco 3 to refinance its Existing PIK Notes (the issuance of the PIK Notes and the application of the proceeds thereof, collectively, the “Refinancing of the Existing PIK Notes”). For more information on the PIK Notes, see “Description of Certain Financing Arrangements—Existing PIK Notes and _PIK Notes.”_ We refer to the Refinancing, the Revolving Credit Facility Amendment, the Refinancing of the Existing PIK Notes, and any actions or steps related to any such transactions, collectively, as the “Transactions.”
