Subsubsection Title: Year ended December 31, 2023 compared to year ended December 31, 2022.
Subsubsection Text: The table below sets out our consolidated results of operations for the year ended December 31, 2023, compared to the year ended December 31, 2022.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: (a) Our recurring revenues are primarily derived from periodic payments we receive in connection with annual software assistance and maintenance contracts, subscription contracts, annual fees from our multi-year contracts with VARs as well as from the sale of Regulatory LTAs. For further information, see “Management’s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of _operations—Revenue recognition—Recurring” and “Management’s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations—Key factors affecting our results of operations—Recurring contracted revenues and high Customer Retention Rate.”_ Recurring revenue is not a recognized measure of financial performance or liquidity under IFRS or any other internationally accepted accounting principles and therefore no undue reliance should be placed on such data contained in this Offering Memorandum. See “Presentation of financial and other information—Non-IFRS financial measures.” (b) Includes revenues from the sale of software licenses, and professional services, which generate fees generally related to the installation and customization of our software solutions products and to the training services we provide to the customers at the product start-up. For further information, see “Management’s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations—Revenue _recognition—Licenses and professional services.”_ Enterprise Business Unit revenue increased by €6.6 million, or 17.6%, from €37.4 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €44.0 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, mainly as a result of an increase in recurring revenue driven by the consolidation of newly acquired companies (mainly internalized VARs) and the expansion of the business. The organic growth of recurring revenues in the Enterprise Business Unit for the three months ended March 31, 2024 was 7.6%. Professional Business Unit revenue increased by €5.6 million, or 10.9%, from €51.2 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €56.8 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, as a result of an increase in recurring revenue resulting from the consolidation of newly acquired companies (mainly internalized VARs) and the expansion of the business. The organic growth of recurring revenues in the Professional Business Unit for the three months ended March 31, 2024 was 5.8%. Micro Business Unit revenue increased by €30.1 million, or 89.6%, from €33.6 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €63.7 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, mainly as a result of the revenue ----- generated by then-recently acquired companies (including MailUp S.p.A., Mikro and Aplifisa S.L.) and an increase in recurring revenue from sales of FMS solutions for micro businesses and e-invoicing products. The growth in revenue from sales of e-invoicing solutions was largely driven by the final wave of businesses and individuals required to comply with Italian Law No. 205 of December 27, 2017 (Legge di Bilancio), which mandates electronic invoicing for business transactions and the filing of electronic invoices directed to local and central public administrations. Additionally, revenue in this business unit was also driven by strong international sales both in Spain and Turkey. The organic growth of recurring revenues in the Micro Business Unit for the three months ended March 31, 2024 was 21.8%. Digital Finance Business Unit revenue increased by €1.0 million, or 22.2%, from €4.5 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €5.5 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, mainly as a result of the increase in recurring revenue deriving from an increase in the volume of sales of TS Pay, the introduction of new services in TS Pay (e.g., Account Information Service), as well as increasing sales of our rating solutions. Revenue generated from our financial value chain offerings, which include various financial products facilitating e-lending, fiscal trading, and other financial solutions, remained stable. This stability is attributed to our new e-lending solution being in the ramp-up phase, while demand for fiscal trading was negatively affected by legislative changes, such as those impacting the 110% Ecobonus, a tax incentive in Italy designed to promote energy-efficient upgrades through significant tax deductions in the form of credits. These legislative changes directly affect the trading and management of such tax credits within our products, leading to fluctuations in the demand for our fiscal trading services. Market Specific Solutions Business Unit revenue increased by €0.4 million, or 1.7%, from €22.9 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €23.3 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, as a result of the increase in recurring revenue due to customers’ ongoing switch to subscription-based services, which was partially offset by lower demand of our hardware and machinery tools. Cross-Segment Products Business Unit revenue increased by €1.9 million, or 17.0%, from €11.2 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €13.1 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, as a result of the increase in recurring revenue driven by the performance of the three core HR solutions, Welfare, BPaaS, and TS HR. _Cost of raw and other materials_ Cost of raw and other materials increased by €0.7 million, or 5.6%, from €12.4 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €13.1 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, mainly as a result of the increase in the sales (and corresponding costs) of hardware products and the use of third party’s software, due to the organic growth of the business and the change in consolidation perimeter. As a percentage of total revenue, cost of raw and other materials decreased by 1.4 percentage points from 7.7% for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to 6.3% for the three months ended March 31, 2024. _Cost of services_ Cost of services increased by €10.0 million, or 24.0%, from €41.6 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €51.6 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024. The increase mainly reflected the overall increase in costs related to intracloud and other external cost required to manage our solutions, agent commissions and other costs attributable to commercial consulting services, marketing expenses and other service expenses. These cost increases were also due to the organic growth of the business and the change in consolidation perimeter. Cost of services for the three months ended March 31, 2024 was partially offset by a decrease in the costs for noncore services. As a percentage of total revenue, cost of services decreased by 0.9 percentage points from 25.9% for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to 25.0% for the three months ended March 31, 2024. _Personnel costs_ Personnel costs increased by €12.6 million, or 25.6%, from €49.2 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €61.8 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, primarily due to the increase in personnel, as consequence of our organic growth and the acquisitions carried out in the first three months of 2024. As a percentage of total revenue, personnel costs decreased by 0.7 percentage point from 30.6% in the three months ended March 31, 2023 to 29.9% in the three months ended March 31, 2024. ----- _Other operating costs_ Other operating costs increased by €0.3 million, or 20.0%, from €1.5 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €1.8 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, primarily due to an increase in the condominium expenses related to new rental arrangements entered into in the first three months of 2024. _Depreciation and amortization of non-current assets_ Depreciation and amortization of non-current assets increased by €7.3 million, or 14.1%, from €51.9 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €59.2 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, due to due to higher amortization charges as a result of the purchase price allocation process in connection with several acquisitions, including, among others, the acquisition of Mikro, MailUp S.r.l., Aplifisa S.L. and Microntel S.p.A. _Allowance for bad debts_ Allowance for bad debts increased by €0.3 million, or 18.8%, from €1.6 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 compared to €1.9 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024. This increase is attributable to the change in the reporting perimeter following recent acquisitions. On a like-for-like basis, the incidence of bad debts over revenues has slightly improved from 1.0% to 0.9%. As a percentage of total revenue, Allowance for bad debts decreased by 0.1 percentage point from 1.0% for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to 0.9% for the three months ended March 31, 2024. _Operating result_ Operating result increased by €14.2 million from €2.7 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €16.9 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, as a consequence of the factors discussed above and, in particular, the increase of total revenue, which more than offset the overall cost increase. _Finance income_ Finance income increased by €5.4 million, or 174.2%, from €3.1 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €8.5 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, primarily due to an increase of the valuation at market value on March 31, 2024 of certain interest rate swap derivative contracts entered into in April 2022 and classified as non-hedge accounting. Finance income also increased as a result of the interest earned from the foregoing derivative instruments. _Finance cost_ Finance cost increased by €13.0 million, or 38.5%, from €33.8 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €46.8 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, primarily due to an increase in the interest expense resulting from the addition of our Existing 2023 Private Notes and the increase of the average Euribor rate applied to our variable rate indebtedness. The increase in finance cost was partially offset by a loss on the valuation of certain derivative instruments. _Monetary net gain/(loss)_ Monetary gain increased from €0 for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €17.9 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024 due to the increase in the reported value of the monetary assets of our subsidiaries operating in Turkey (which we acquired in September 2023 and, thus, we did not control during the three months ended March 31, 2023) after adjusting for hyperinflation according to IAS 29 (Financial Reporting in Hyperinflationary Economies). _Total income taxes_ Total income taxes increased by €4.3 million from a positive balance of €2.7 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to a negative balance of €1.6 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024, primarily as a consequence of the increase in current income taxes mainly due to the organic growth of the business. This increase was partially offset by a €1.2 million increase in the positive effect of deferred income taxes. ----- _Profit/(Loss) for the period_ For the three months ended March 31, 2023 we recorded a loss of €25.3 million, while for the three months ended March 31, 2024 we recorded a loss of €5.1 million. Such positive trend was due to the reasons discussed above. _Adjusted EBITDA_ Adjusted EBITDA increased by €21.0 million, or 34.0%, from €61.7 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €82.7 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024. This increase was primarily due to the change in the consolidation area as a result of our acquisition activity and to the organic growth in the first three months of 2024. For further details, see the calculation of Adjusted EBITDA presented under “Summary historical _financial information and other data—Other financial and pro forma data.” The change in the consolidation area_ and the organic growth in the first three months of 2024 also positively impacted Adjusted EBITDA margin, which increased from 38.3% for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to 40.1% for the three months ended March 31, 2024.

This growth was mainly the result of our organic growth due to higher spending from existing customers through cross-selling between our HR, Trust Services, Extended CRM and Digital Finance product lines, and the acquisition of new customers. Total revenue also increased by the first time consolidation of the several companies in which we acquired a controlling interest or a 100% interest in 2023 and which contributed €84.5 million (primarily relating to the consolidation of Readytec S.p.A., MailUp S.p.A. and Mikro) to the overall revenue increase and the revenue contribution of the bolt-on acquisitions we made in the year ended December 31, 2022, which did not therefore have a full-period impact in such year. ----- Our total revenue broken down by business unit for the years ended December 31, 2022 and 2023 was as follows[(*)]:

Subsubsection Title: Year ended December 31, 2022 compared to year ended December 31, 2021
Subsubsection Text: The table below sets out our consolidated results of operations for the year ended December 31, 2022 compared to the year ended December 31, 2021.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: (*) Certain line items in the revenue breakdown by business unit presented in this Offering Memorandum have been reclassified following the reallocation of revenue derived from our Trust Solutions product offering from the Market Specific Solutions business unit to the HR business unit, which is reflected in our Unaudited Interim Financial Statements. As a result of this reallocation, a new business unit, now referred to as “Cross-Segment Products,” was created, replacing the former HR business unit. Therefore, the revenue breakdown by business unit for the periods and fiscal years prior to March 31, 2024, presented in this Offering Memorandum, has been made based on same classification that is reflected in our Unaudited Interim Financial Statements. See “Presentation of financial and other _information—Business units and revenue breakdowns.”_ (a) Our recurring revenues are primarily derived from periodic payments we receive in connection with annual software assistance and maintenance contracts, subscription contracts, annual fees from our multi-year contracts with VARs as well as from the sale of Regulatory LTAs. For further information, see “Management’s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of _operations—Revenue recognition—Recurring” and “Management’s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations—Key factors affecting our results of operations—Recurring contracted revenues and high Customer Retention Rate.”_ Recurring revenue is not a recognized measure of financial performance or liquidity under IFRS or any other internationally accepted accounting principles and therefore no undue reliance should be placed on such data contained in this Offering Memorandum. See “Presentation of financial and other information—Non-IFRS financial measures.” (b) Includes revenues from the sale of software licenses and professional services, which generate fees generally related to the installation and customization of our software solutions products and to the training services we provide to the customers at the product start-up. For further information, see “Management’s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations—Revenue _recognition—Licenses and professional services.”_ Enterprise Business Unit revenue increased by €39.5 million, or 31.6%, from €125.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €164.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, mainly as a result of an increase in recurring revenue driven by the accelerated transition from sales of software licenses to subscription-based services as well as the change in consolidation perimeter, which also drove the increase in other revenue. Professional Business Unit revenue increased by €46.0 million, or 27.3%, from €168.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €214.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, mainly as a result of an increase in recurring revenue and, in particular, revenue deriving from enhanced sales of cloud solutions due to upselling, migration to cloud-based alternatives and our “more-for-more” strategy that offers to customers enhanced features, services, and benefits at a higher price point. Micro Business Unit revenue increased by €62.1 million, or 51.9%, from €119.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €181.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, mainly as a result of the revenue generated by then-recently acquired companies (including MailUp S.p.A., Mikro and Aplifisa S.L.) and a strong increase in recurring revenue driven by higher sales across all customer segments and, particularly, micro and small businesses as well as vertical segments, including international customers. Notably, substantial revenue was generated in the Spanish segment that outperformed overall market growth. ----- Digital Finance Business Unit revenue increased by €2.9 million, or 16.1%, from €18.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €20.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, mainly as a result of an increase in recurring revenue driven by sales derived from usage of TS Pay as well as other revenue derived from sales of our rating solutions. This increase was partially offset by a decrease in the number or value of invoices being traded or processed through our digital finance platform as a result of legislative changes and high interest rates, which reduced market demand for financing solutions. Market Specific Solutions Business Unit revenue increased by €4.5 million, or 4.7%, from €96.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €100.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, mainly as a result of an increase in recurring revenue driven by the acceleration of the switch to subscription models of solutions and sales of construction, legal and solutions for CAF. Cross-Segment Products Business Unit revenue increased by €10.2 million, or 25.2%, from €40.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €50.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, mainly as a result of an increase in recurring revenue driven by sales of our TS HR, Welfare and BPaaS solutions. _Cost of raw and other materials_ Cost of raw and other materials increased by €4.3 million, or 8.4%, from €51.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €55.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, mainly as a result of the increase in the sales (and corresponding costs) of hardware products and the use of third party’s software as well as the increase in fuel costs, primarily due to the change in consolidation perimeter as a result of then-recently acquired companies. As a percentage of total revenue, cost of raw and other materials decreased by 1.4 percentage points from 9.0% in 2022 to 7.6% in 2023. This decrease was primarily due to a minor impact on revenue from the cost of goods sold for the year ending December 31, 2023, which increased organically by 4.2% compared to 2022 mainly due to a reduced contribution from low-margin businesses (such as hardware and CAD/CAM) and the optimization of external customer support operations. _Cost of services_ Cost of services increased by €37.6 million, or 26.9%, from €139.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €177.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2023. The increase mainly reflected the overall increase in costs related to intracloud and other external cost required to manage our solutions, marketing expenses, agent commissions and other costs attributable to commercial consulting services, customer support costs, management and administrative consulting costs and costs of non-core services (comprising advisory expenses related to mergers and acquisitions as well as reorganization and cost-saving projects. In addition, the increase of cost of services reflect an increase in certain capitalized product development costs primarily related to key projects, including TS Enterprise, TS Digital, SaaS Applications, STR Construction, and TS Studio. Cost of services for the year ended December 31, 2023 was partially offset by a decrease in financial interest costs, consulting and copyright costs and other costs for education services. As a percentage of total revenue, cost of services decreased by 0.4 percentage points from 24.6% in 2022 to 24.2% in 2023 as a result of increasing economies of scale that characterize our business. _Personnel costs_ Personnel costs increased by €41.7 million, or 26.1%, from €160.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €201.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, primarily due to the effect of then-recently acquired companies and partially from the organic growth achieved in 2023, which led to increased employee hires. For the year ended December 31, 2023, personnel costs increased organically by 7.6% compared to the year ended December 31, 2022. This increase has resulted in higher productivity at the Group level, as measured by revenue per full-time employee offset partially by integration of newly acquired companies. As a percentage of total revenue, personnel costs decreased by 0.7 percentage points from 28.2% in 2022 to 27.5% in 2023. The number of full time employees grew from 3,256 as of December 31, 2022 to 4,644 as of December 31, 2023. _Other operating costs_ Other operating costs increased by €1.2 million, or 30.8%, from €3.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €5.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, due to, among other things, an increase in condominium expenses related to new rental arrangements entered into in 2023 following the consolidation of then-recently acquired companies. ----- _Depreciation and amortization of non-current assets_ Depreciation and amortization of non-current assets increased by €15.8 million, or 7.6%, from €208.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €224.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, as a result of higher amortization charges due to the purchase price allocation process in connection with several acquisitions, including, among others, the acquisition of Sigma Sistemi S.r.l., Readytec S.p.A., Mikro, MailUp S.r.l., Aplifisa S.L. and Microntel S.p.A. Additionally, there was an increase in the amortization of capitalized development costs, driven by both the organic growth in the capitalization of development expenses and the acquisitions made during 2023. _Allowance for bad debts_ Allowance for bad debts increased by €1.5 million, or 27.3% from €5.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 compared to €7.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, primarily due to the change in consolidation perimeter as a consequence of the acquisitions in 2023. _Other provisions for risks and charges_ Other provisions for risks and charges decreased by €0.5 million, or 20.8%, from €2.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €1.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, primarily due to a decrease in the provision for litigation and disputes relating to the release of risk provisions due to the settlement of certain disputes that arose in previous years. _Impairment of non-current assets_ Impairment of non-current assets decreased from €78.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €0 for the year ended December 31, 2023, due to a goodwill impairment charge that was recorded for the Digital Finance business unit, which was recognized following the results of the annual impairment test conducted for each business unit. No additional impairment of non-current assets has been recognized for the year ended December 31, 2023. _Operating result_ Operating result increased by €141.3 million, from a loss of €81.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to a gain of €60.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, primarily as a result of the increase in total revenue and the improvement in overall operating margin. _Finance income_ Finance income decreased by €19.4 million, or 44.0%, from €44.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €24.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, primarily due to the valuation at market value on December 31, 2023 of certain interest rate swap derivative contracts entered into in April 2022 and classified as non-hedge accounting, partially offset by interest income accrued on the foregoing interest rate swap derivative contracts. _Finance cost_ Finance cost increased by €55.3 million, or 44.5%, from €124.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €179.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, primarily due to an increase in the interest expenses and financing fees due to the outstanding indebtedness of TeamSystem Group (including the issuance of the Existing 2022 Private Notes) and the Revolving Credit Facility as well as a loss on the valuation of certain derivative instruments. This increase was partially offset by a decrease in the revaluation of the Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders. _Monetary net gain/(loss)_ Monetary gain increased from nil for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €15.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, primarily due to the increase in the reported value of the monetary assets of our subsidiaries operating in Turkey (which we acquired in September 2023, thus, we did not control during the year ended December 31, 2022) after adjusting for hyperinflation according to IAS 29 (Financial Reporting in _Hyperinflationary Economies)._ ----- _Total income taxes_ Total income taxes decreased by €10.9 million, or 72.7%, from a positive balance of €15.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to a positive balance of €4.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2023, as a consequence of the increase of €11.8 million in current income taxes mainly due to the increase of the tax base. This increase was partially offset by a €0.9 million increase in the positive effect of deferred income taxes. _Profit/(Loss) for the year_ Loss decreased by €71.3 million, or 48.7%, from a loss of €146.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to a loss of €75.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2023 for the reasons discussed above. _Adjusted EBITDA_ Adjusted EBITDA increased by €86.5 million, or 38.1%, from €227.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €313.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2023. This increase was primarily attributable to both non-organic and organic growth associated with existing customer upsell and new customer acquisition along with less than proportional operating cost increases, primarily due to increased operational efficiency and economies of scale achieved throughout the streamlining of operations and the merger of certain of our subsidiaries into TeamSystem. For further details, see the calculation of Adjusted EBITDA presented under “Summary historical financial information and other data—Other financial and pro forma data.” Improved resale product margins, reduced infrastructure costs for Cloud products, lower personnel costs from hiring timing, and efficiency gains in Customer Operations, R&D, and G&A functions also positively impacted Adjusted EBITDA margin, which increased from 40.0% for the year ended December 31, 2022 to 42.8% for the year ended December 31, 2023.

For further information, see “Presentation of financial information—Comparability of the Financial Statements.” ----- _Total revenue_ Total revenue increased by €157.3 million, or 38.3%, from €410.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €568.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. This growth was primarily the result of (i) an expansion of our cloud business, which resulted in an increase in recurring revenues, (ii) the 2021 Acquisition, which closed on February 18, 2021, resulting in the 2021 TeamSystem Group being consolidated in the 2021 Financial Statements only for part of that year (i.e. since the date of the 2021 Acquisition to December 31, 2023) (iii) the first time consolidation of several companies in which we acquired a controlling interest or a 100% interest in 2022 and (iv) the revenue contribution of the bolt-on acquisitions we made in the year ended December 31, 2021, which did not therefore have a full-period impact in such year. Had the 2021 Acquisition been completed on January 1, 2021, our total revenues would have increased by €79.1 million or 16.2%, from €489.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €568.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. For further information, see “Management’s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of _operations—Revenue recognition—Recurring” and “Management’s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations—Key factors affecting our results of operations—Recurring contracted revenues and high Customer Retention Rate.”_ Recurring revenue is not a recognized measure of financial performance or liquidity under IFRS or any other internationally accepted accounting principles and therefore no undue reliance should be placed on such data contained in this Offering Memorandum. See “Presentation of financial and other information—Non-IFRS financial measures.” (b) Includes revenues from the sale of software licenses and professional services, which generate fees generally related to the installation and customization of our software solutions products and to the training services we provide to the customers at the product start-up. For further information, see “Management’s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations—Revenue _recognition—Licenses and professional services.”_ Enterprise Business Unit revenue increased by €30.4 million, or 32.1%, from €94.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €125.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, due to an increase in recurring ----- revenue, mainly attributable to our growth in the cloud business and strong demand for ERP solutions driven by Industry 4.0 incentives. In addition, other revenue increased primarily due to the consolidation of then-recently acquired companies. For the year ended December 31, 2022, organic revenues for the Enterprise Business Unit increased by 8.9% compared to the year ended December 31, 2021, primarily driven by a 10.3% increase in recurring revenues. Professional Business Unit revenue increased by €48.5 million, or 40.3%, from €120.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €168.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, due to (i) the 2021 Acquisition, which closed on February 18, 2021, resulting in the 2021 TeamSystem Group being consolidated in the 2021 Financial Statements only for part of that year (i.e. since the date of the 2021 Acquisition to December 31, 2023) and (ii) an increase in recurring revenue, mainly attributable to contributions from revenue generated by companies acquired in 2021. Micro Business Unit revenue increased by €34.3 million, or 40.2%, from €85.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €119.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, primarily as a result of (i) the 2021 Acquisition, which closed on February 18, 2021, resulting in the 2021 TeamSystem Group being consolidated in the 2021 Financial Statements only for part of that year (i.e. since the date of the 2021 Acquisition to December 31, 2023) and (ii) an increase in recurring revenue driven by increased sales across all customer segments, including international customers. Digital Finance Business Unit revenue increased by €6.2 million, or 52.5%, from €11.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €18.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, primarily as a result of (i) the 2021 Acquisition, which closed on February 18, 2021, resulting in the 2021 TeamSystem Group being consolidated in the 2021 Financial Statements only for part of that year (i.e. since the date of the 2021 Acquisition to December 31, 2023) and (ii) an increase in sales across all product lines (namely, TS Pay, Digital Invoice, Fiscal Trading and TeamSystem Rating). Market Specific Solutions Business Unit revenue increased by €26.5 million, or 38.1%, from €69.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €96.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, mainly as a result of an increase in recurring and other revenue driven by sales of CAD/CAM, construction and legal products. Cross-Segment Products Business Unit revenue increased by €11.4 million, or 39.2%, from €29.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €40.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, mainly as a result of (i) the 2021 Acquisition, which closed on February 18, 2021, resulting in the 2021 TeamSystem Group being consolidated in the 2021 Financial Statements only for part of that year (i.e. since the date of the 2021 Acquisition to December 31, 2023) and (ii) an increase in recurring revenue driven by the consolidation of then-recently acquired companies and the accelerated adoption of our HR business solutions through cross-selling initiatives within our customer base. _Cost of raw and other materials_ Cost of raw and other materials increased by €15.2 million, or 42.0%, from €36.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €51.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, primarily due to (i) the 2021 Acquisition, which closed on February 18, 2021, resulting in the 2021 TeamSystem Group being consolidated in the 2021 Financial Statements only for part of that year (i.e. since the date of the 2021 Acquisition to December 31, 2023) and (ii) the increase in the sales (and corresponding costs) of three-dimensional printing hardware, machinery and the use of third party’s software, primarily due to a strong sales performance in 2022. As a percentage of total revenue, cost of raw and other materials increased by 0.2 percentage point from 8.8% in 2021 to 9.0% in 2022. Had the 2021 Acquisition been completed on January 1, 2021, our cost of raw and other materials would have increased by €9.7 million or 23.3%, from €41.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €51.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. _Cost of services_ Cost of services increased by €35.0 million, or 34.4%, from €104.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €139.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. This increase primarily reflected the overall increase of costs related to certain agent commissions, consulting and third party services, advertising and marketing expenses, intracloud and other external costs, as a result of the growth of our business. Cost of services for the year ended December 31, 2022 was partially offset by a decrease in costs of non-core services, comprising costs relating to merger and acquisition transactions completed in 2022 and costs for strategic and reorganization projects. As a percentage of total revenue, cost of services decreased by 0.9 percentage points from 25.5% in 2021 ----- to 24.6% in 2022. Had the 2021 Acquisition been completed on January 1, 2021, our cost of services would have increased by €26.0 million or 22.9%, from €113.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €139.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. _Personnel costs_ Personnel costs increased by €44.0 million, or 37.9%, from €116.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €160.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, primarily due to the effect of then-recently acquired companies and partially from the organic growth achieved in 2022, which led to increased employee hires. For the year ended December 31, 2022, personnel costs increased organically by 3.6% compared to the year ended December 31, 2021. As a percentage of total revenue, personnel costs remained stable at 30.0% in 2022 from 30.3% 2022, with the number of full time employees increasing from 2,785 as of December 31, 2021 to 3,256 as of December 31, 2022. Had the 2021 Acquisition been completed on January 1, 2021, our personnel costs would have increased by €18.5 million or 13.1%, from €141.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €160.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. _Other operating costs_ Other operating costs decreased by €0.6 million, or 13.3%, from €4.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €3.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. The decrease was primarily due to the decrease of the cost of agreements with customers and agents. _Depreciation and amortization of non-current assets_ Depreciation and amortization of non-current assets increased by €37.9 million, or 22.2%, from €170.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €208.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. The increase was primarily due to the increased amortization of intangible IFRS assets due to the acquisition of TeamSystem Group in February 2021 and the subsequent allocation of the price paid for the acquisition which led to an increase in intangible assets. _Allowance for bad debts_ Allowance for bad debts increased by €1.7 million, or 44.7% from €3.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €5.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. The increase was primarily due to (i) the 2021 Acquisition, which closed on February 18, 2021, resulting in the 2021 TeamSystem Group being consolidated in the 2021 Financial Statements only for part of that year (i.e. since the date of the 2021 Acquisition to December 31, 2023) and (ii) the change in consolidation perimeter as a consequence of the acquisitions in 2022. _Other provisions for risks and charges_ Other provisions for risks and charges increased by €2.3 million, or 2300.0%, from €0.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €2.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. The increase was due to (i) the 2021 Acquisition, which closed on February 18, 2021, resulting in the 2021 TeamSystem Group being consolidated in the 2021 Financial Statements only for part of that year (i.e. since the date of the 2021 Acquisition to December 31, 2023) and (ii) an increase in the provision for litigation and disputes. _Impairment of non-current assets Impairment of non-current assets increased from €0 for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €78.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, due to a goodwill impairment charge that was recorded for the Digital Finance business unit, which was recognized following the results of the annual impairment test conducted for each business unit. Operating result_ Operating result decreased by €56.4 million, or 227.4%, from a loss of €24.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to a loss of €81.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, as a consequence of the factors discussed above and, in particular, the impairment of non-current assets. ----- _Finance income_ Finance income increased by €38.4 million or 673.7%, from €5.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €44.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. The increase was largely attributable to (i) the 2021 Acquisition, which closed on February 18, 2021, resulting in the 2021 TeamSystem Group being consolidated in the 2021 Financial Statements only for part of that year (i.e. since the date of the 2021 Acquisition to December 31, 2023) and (ii) the valuation at market value on December 31, 2022 of certain interest rate swap derivative contracts entered into in April 2022 and classified as non-hedge accounting. The increase was also the result of the depreciation of the fair value of the Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries as a result of the re-measurement of the initial exercise price of certain put and call options. Had the 2021 Acquisition been completed on January 1, 2021, our finance income would have increased by €32.7 million or 28.7%, from €11.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €44.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. _Finance cost_ Finance cost increased by €14.2 million, or 12.9%, from €110.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €124.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. This increase is primarily the result of an increase in the interest expense due on the Existing Senior Secured Notes, the Existing 2022 Private Notes and the Existing PIK Notes and the revaluation of Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries. This increase was partially offset by a decrease of finance fees attributed to a lower volume of indebtedness issued in 2022 relative to 2021. Had the 2021 Acquisition been completed on January 1, 2021, our finance costs would have increased by €24.6 million or 24.6%, from €99.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €124.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. _Total income taxes_ Total income taxes decreased by €50.3 million or 77.0%, from a positive balance of €65.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to a positive balance of €15.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, primarily as a consequence of the (i) the 2021 Acquisition, which closed on February 18, 2021, resulting in the 2021 TeamSystem Group being consolidated in the 2021 Financial Statements only for part of that year (i.e. since the date of the 2021 Acquisition to December 31, 2023) and (ii) decrease in deferred income taxes due to the reversal of deferred tax liabilities recorded in 2021 after the revaluation of the tax basis of intangible software and trademark assets by certain legal entities within the Group. The decrease in total income taxes was also due to an increase of €4.9 million in current income taxes. _Profit/(Loss) for the year_ Loss increased by €82.5 million, or 128.2%, from €64.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €146.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2022, as a consequence of the factors described above. Had the 2021 Acquisition been completed on January 1, 2021, our loss would have increased by €54.9 million or 59.9%, from €91.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €146.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. _Adjusted EBITDA_ Adjusted EBITDA increased by €57.2 million, or 33.6%, from €170.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €227.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. The increase was primarily attributable to the organic growth, associated with less than proportional operating cost increases, primarily due to effective control over personnel and other non-personnel expenses. For further details, see the calculation of Adjusted EBITDA presented under “Summary historical financial information and other data—Other financial and pro forma data.” Adjusted EBITDA margin decreased from 41.4% for the year ended December 31, 2021 to 40.0% for the year ended December 31, 2022. Had the 2021 Acquisition been completed on January 1, 2021, our Adjusted EBITDA would have increased by €27.6 million or 13.8%, from €199.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €227.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2022.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Liquidity and capital resources
Subsubsection Text: Following the consummation of the Transactions, we expect that our principal sources of liquidity will be our existing cash and cash equivalents, cash generated from operations and any borrowings under the Revolving Credit Facility. The Revolving Credit Facility Agreement contains various conditions that must be satisfied in order for the lenders thereunder to make loans available to us under the Revolving Credit Facility. See “Description of certain financing arrangements—Revolving Credit Facility Agreement.” Cash flows from our financing activities have in the past included, among others, proceeds from the Existing Notes and the Revolving ----- Credit Facility. Historically, our principal uses of cash have been, and we expect that our principal uses of cash following the consummation of the Transactions will be, to fund capital expenditures, provide working capital, meet debt service requirements, fund acquisitions, purchase of non-controlling shares, pay earn outs and exercise certain put and call options from time to time pursuant to the Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries. On or about the Issue Date, we expect to upsize the Revolving Credit Facility from €180.0 million to €300.0 million, hence further enhancing our liquidity sources. We believe that our operating cash flows and borrowing capacity under the Revolving Credit Facility will be sufficient to meet our requirements and commitments for the foreseeable future. However, we are highly leveraged and have significant debt service obligations. Our actual financing requirements will depend on a number of factors, many of which are beyond our control. See “Risk factors—Risks related to our structure and the _Transactions—Our substantial leverage and debt service obligations could materially adversely affect our business, financial position and results of operations and preclude us from satisfying our obligations under our indebtedness.”_ The following table illustrates our cash flows from the indicated sources:

For further information, see “Presentation of financial information—Comparability of the Financial Statements.” _Cash flow generated from operating activities_ Our cash flow from operating activities increased by €2.2 million from €176.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €178.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. The increase was primarily due to our organic growth and the effect of a number of bolt-on acquisitions in 2022. In light of the fact that December 31, 2022 was not a business day, the cash flow from operating activities for the year ended December 31, 2022 was impacted by the postponement of the collections of trade receivables due on December 31, 2022 to January 2023. Without considering such postponement, the increase in cash flow from operating activities from the year ended December 31, 2021 to the year ended December 31, 2022 would have been higher had the 2021 Acquisition been completed on January 1, 2021, our cash flow from operating activities would have increased by €12.6 million or 7.6%, from €166.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 to €178.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2022. Our cash flow from operating activities increased by €32.4 million from €178.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2022 to €211.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2023. The increase was primarily due to our organic growth and the effect of a number of bolt-on acquisitions in 2023. In light of the fact that December 31, 2023 was not a business day, the cash flow from operating activities for the year ended December 31, 2023 was impacted by the postponement of the collections of trade receivables due on December 31, 2023 to January 2024. Without considering the postponement of the collections of certain receivables discussed above for the years ending December 31, 2022 and 2023, the increase in cash flow from operating activities from the year ended December 31, 2022 to the year ended December 31, 2023 would have been €32.9 million. Our cash flow from operating activities decreased by €1.8 million from €72.3 million for the three months ended March 31, 2023 to €70.5 million for the three months ended March 31, 2024. The decrease was primarily due to weekend effect, where service renewals falling on a holiday or weekend at month-end result in revenue are recorded in the following month. In light of the fact that March 31, 2024 was not a business day, the cash flow from operating activities for the three months ended March 31, 2024 was impacted by the postponement of the collections of certain electronic bank receipts due on March 31, 2024 to April 2024. Without considering the postponement of the collections of certain receivables discussed above for the three months ended March 31, 2024, the operating cash flow would have been €98.3 million. ----- _Cash flow from (used in) investing activities_ For the year ended December 31, 2021, our cash flow used in investing activities amounted to €1,947.5 million, reflecting, among other things, €13.1 million of capitalized development costs, €16.6 million of capital expenditures on tangible and intangible assets and €1,917.9 million for equity investments for the acquisition of TeamSystem Group by H&F Fund IX and for the acquisition of Billin, TeamSystem 9 S.r.l., Logical Soft S.r.l., Itacme Informatica S.r.l. and SGS System House S.r.l. For the year ended December 31, 2022, our cash flow used in investing activities amounted to €73.4 million (a €1,874.1 million decrease from the year ended December 31, 2021), reflecting, among other things, €17.2 million of capitalized development costs, €19.2 million of capital expenditures on tangible and intangible assets, and €37.0 million for further equity investments (net of cash and cash equivalents acquired) in the acquired subsidiary Ciaomanager S.r.l. and the acquisition of Storeden S.r.l., Teamsyver S.r.l., IT Review S.r.l., CZ Informatica S.r.l., Progetto Software S.r.l., SIA S.r.l. and Algoritmi S.r.l. For the year ended December 31, 2023, our cash flow used in investing activities amounted to €335.0 million (a €261.6 million increase from the year ended December 31, 2022), reflecting, among other things, €23.2 million of capitalized development costs, €18.8 million of capital expenditures on tangible and intangible assets, as well as €292.8 million (net of cash and cash equivalents acquired) for the acquisition of, among others, Mailup S.p.A., Mikro Yazılımevi Yazılım Hizmetleri Bilgisayar Sanayi ve Ticaret A.Ş., Rean S.r.l., Readytec S.p.A., Readytec Emilia S.r.l., Aplifisa S.L.U., Acumbamail S.L., Microntel S.p.A. and Sigma Sistemi S.r.l. For the three months ended March 31, 2023, our cash flow used in investing activities amounted to €86.1 million, reflecting, among other things, €5.8 million of capitalized development costs, €5.1 million of capital expenditures on tangible and intangible assets as well as €75.3 million (net of cash and cash equivalents acquired) for the acquisition of Readytec S.p.A., Readytec Emilia S.r.l., Aplifisa S.L.U., Ticcyl Digital S.L.U., Marclamara S.L. and Microntel S.r.l. For the three months ended March 31, 2024, our cash flow used in investing activities amounted to €19.4 million (a €66.7 million decrease from the three months ended March 31, 2023), reflecting, among other things, €9.9 million of capitalized development costs, €5.6 million of capital expenditures on tangible and intangible assets, as well as €3.9 million (net of cash and cash equivalents acquired) for the acquisitions of TeamSystem 12 S.r.l. and Macrogroup S.r.l. _Cash flow (used in)/generated from financing activities_ Our cash flow used in financing activities for the year ended December 31, 2021 was €1,829.4 million, mainly reflecting (i) interest paid on the Existing Senior Secured Notes and the Existing PIK Notes (€44.5 million); (ii) payment of leases liabilities, consisting of principal and interests, according to IFRS 16 (€6.4 million); (iii) drawings under the Revolving Credit Facility (€75.0 million); (iv) the repayment of all amounts outstanding under a previously existing revolving credit facility (€45.0 million); (v) the issuance of the Existing Senior Secured Notes for an aggregate principal amount of €1,150.0 million as well as the issuance of the Existing PIK Notes for an aggregated principal amount of €300.0 million; (vi) the redemption of certain previously existing notes (€750.0 million) with the proceeds from the Existing Senior Secured Notes and the payment of interest under such previously existing notes until the redemption thereof, as well as the early redemption premia due thereunder; (vii) a capital contribution in TeamSystem Holdco to finance the acquisition of TeamSystem Group (€1,358.3 million); and (viii) €132.4 million of Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries paid in connection with the acquisition of further equity interests in Aliaslab S.p.A., Skylab Italia S.r.l., Danea Soft S.r.l. and Madbit Entertainment S.r.l. and the payment of earn-outs primarily relating to investments in Software del Sol S.A., Modefinance S.r.l. and TechMass S.r.l. Our cash flow used in financing activities for the year ended December 31, 2022 was €19.0 million, mainly reflecting (i) the issuance of €185.0 million aggregate principal amount of the Existing 2022 Private Notes and associated financing fees (€6.4 million); (ii) €61.3 million related to the payment of interest under the Existing Senior Secured Notes, the Existing 2022 Private Notes and the Existing PIK Notes; (iii) €75.0 million related to the repayment on the Revolving Credit Facility; (iv) €8.3 million related to the payment of lease liabilities, consisting of principal and interests, according to IFRS 16; and (v)€45.8 million of Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries paid in connection with the acquisition of further equity interests in MBM Italia S.r.l. and the payment of earn-outs primarily relating to investments in Software del Sol S.A., Modefinance S.r.l., Logical Soft S.r.l., IT Review S.r.l. and Progetto Studio S.r.l. ----- Our cash flow generated in financing activities for the year ended December 31, 2023 was €25.0 million, mainly reflecting (i) the issuance of €195.0 million aggregate principal amount of the Existing 2023 Private Notes and associated financing fees (€6.7 million); (ii) €111.4 million of finance costs, mainly attributable to the payment of interest under the Existing Senior Secured Notes, the Existing Private Notes, the Existing PIK Notes and the payment of IFRS 16 leases liabilities, consisting of principal and interests; and (iii) €40.7 million of Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries paid for the payment of earn-outs primarily relating to investments in, among others, Storeden S.r.l., TeamSyver S.r.l., Algoritmi S.r.l., SIA S.r.l., Modefinance S.r.l., Area 32 S.r.l., Progetto Studio S.r.l. and NewTronic S.r.l. Our cash flow used in financing activities for the three months ended March 31, 2023 was €19.8 million, mainly reflecting (i) €15.7 million of payment of interest under the Existing Private Notes and the Existing Floating Rate Notes and the payment of leases liabilities, consisting of principal and interests, according to IFRS 16; and (ii) €0.6 million of Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries. Our cash flow used in financing activities for the three months ended March 31, 2024 was €35.6 million, mainly reflecting (i) €23.7 million of payment of interest under the Existing Private Notes and the Existing Floating Rate Notes, and the payment of interest on IFRS 16 leases liabilities; (ii) €25.4 million of Liabilities to Non Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries paid in connection with the acquisition of further equity interests in Modefinance, Progetto Software and CZ Informatica; and (iii) €15.0 million drawn from the Revolving Credit Facility.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Net working capital
Subsubsection Text: We focus on the management of our net working capital. The following table sets forth the components of our net working capital as of December 31, 2021, 2022 and 2023 and as of March 31, 2024.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: (*) Includes the results of the 2021 TeamSystem Group only since its acquisition by Brunello Bidco on February 18, 2021. For further information, see “Presentation of financial information—Comparability of the Financial Statements.” Due to the subscription-based nature of most of our contractual arrangements, our net working capital is subject to some extent to seasonality. Net working capital is generally cash generative in the first and second quarter. This is due to the timing of the collection of trade receivables in our Enterprise and Professional business units and, partially, in our Market Specific Solutions business unit. Enterprise and Professional and, to a lesser extent, Market Specific Solutions’ customer invoicing is concentrated at the beginning of the year, when most of the annual fees related to assistance and maintenance contracts and subscription contracts are invoiced. For our contractual arrangements, in our Micro and Cross-Segment Products business unit which mainly consist of subscription contracts, the billing pattern is not as seasonal, given customers generally pay upfront the subscription fees at the subscription date and are therefore normally spread throughout the year. Contracts with VARs also generate more frequent cash inflows as they are usually invoiced on a quarterly basis and the related receivables are collected in approximately three months. Accordingly, our net working capital needs are high in the first quarter, reaching their peak during the first quarter (before we start collecting receivables from our Enterprise and Professional business units) and gradually decreasing through the end of the year. Deferred income, included in “Other current liabilities,” has the same seasonality as the invoicing of sales, with an inverse correlation to trade receivables (i.e. it is amortized on a straight-line basis through the end of the year). As a result of the seasonality of our net working capital, we plan for fixed capital expenditures for employee salaries and VAT payments, which are due monthly and, with respect to VAT, at the time the invoice is raised (despite the delay in customer payment). Net working capital decreased by €2.9 million from negative €30.3 million as of December 31, 2021 to negative €33.2 million as of December 31, 2022, mainly due to a €20.9 million increase in other current liabilities, primarily ----- as a result of a €16.6 million increase in our deferred revenues (which mainly relate to the portion of revenue for software subscriptions attributable to future financial years, based upon the duration of the underlying contracts), which was only partially offset by a €22.1 million increase in trade receivables. This change in net working capital was also impacted by the fact that December 31, 2022 was not a business day and therefore the collection of receivables due on December 31, 2022 was delayed to January 2023. Without this effect, we estimate that the net working capital as of December 31, 2022 would have been considerably negative and, consequently, the decrease compared to December 31, 2021 would have been considerable. Net working capital increased by €13.3 million from negative €33.2 million as of December 31, 2022 to negative €19.9 million as of December 31, 2023, mainly due to a €53.8 million increase in trade receivables and a €25.2 million increase in other receivables, which was only partially offset by a €62.4 million increase in other current liabilities. This change in net working capital was also impacted by the fact that December 31, 2023 was not a business day and therefore the collection of receivables due on December 31, 2023 was delayed to January 2024. Without this effect, we estimate that the net working capital as of December 31, 2023 would have been negative €28.3 million and, consequently, the decrease compared to December 31, 2022 would have been equal to €12.8 million. Net working capital decreased by €10.6 million from negative €19.9 million as of December 31, 2023 to negative €30.5 million as of March 31, 2024, mainly due to a €226.1 million increase in other current liabilities (almost entirely attributable to an increase in our deferred revenues, which mainly related to the portion of revenue for software subscriptions attributable to future financial years, based upon the duration of the underlying contracts) and a €13.3 million decrease in other receivables, which was only partially offset by a €229.0 million increase in trade receivables.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Capital expenditure
Subsubsection Text: Capital expenditure encompasses our total expenditure on tangible assets (net of disposal of tangible assets) and intangible assets, as well as the capitalization of development costs in respect thereof, broken down in personnel costs and service costs. In particular, we capitalize and amortize development costs incurred in any given year over their estimated useful life. With respect to tangible and intangible assets, our business is characterized by low levels of capital expenditure in line with the industry in which we operate. Our capital expenditure does not include acquisition costs or payments in connection with our Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries (see “—Critical accounting policies—Business combinations”). Our capital expenditure incurred in the periods under review is set out below:

This increase reflected an overall increase in capitalized costs due to is mainly due to our organic growth and the effect of then-recently acquired companies. For the year ended December 31, 2023, our capital expenditure was €42.0 million, an increase of €5.6 million from €36.4 million in the year ended December 31, 2022. This increase reflected an overall increase in capitalized costs due to is mainly due to our organic growth and the effect of then-recently acquired companies. For the three months ended March 31, 2024, our capital expenditure was €15.5 million, an increase of €4.6 million from €10.9 million in the three months ended March 31, 2023. This increase reflected certain investments to complete our One Platform strategic project. ----- As of the date of this Offering Memorandum, we expect our capital expenditure for 2024 to be in line with our capital expenditure for 2023. Subsection Title: Off-balance sheet arrangements

(4) Excludes the Revolving Credit Facility. The Revolving Credit Facility is expected to mature on the RCF Maturity Date, provided that, to the extent that more than €200.0 million of the Existing Senior Secured Notes remain outstanding as at the date falling six months prior to the First Existing Senior Secured Notes Maturity Date, the RCF Maturity Date shall be adjusted at such time to be the date falling three months prior to the First Existing Senior Notes Maturity Date. The table above does not include guarantee obligations in the ordinary course of business or contingent liabilities. See “—Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries” below. _Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries_ Our agreements with the non-controlling shareholders of our majority-owned subsidiaries normally provide for put and call option arrangements on the non-controlling stake which give our partners the right to cause us to purchase the non-controlling interest within predetermined periods, as well as for certain earn-out arrangements or other types of deferred consideration based on the performance of such businesses. We define our overall liability with respect to such put and call option and earn-out arrangements relating to non-controlling holdings of the Group as, collectively, the “Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries”. The Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries reflect our estimate of discounted future disbursements in connection with such options and earn-out arrangements, based on the applicable contractual provisions. The strike price of the put and call options is determined based on normalized earnings parameters of the relevant companies plus or minus the net financial position for the period in which the put or call option will be exercised. The discount rate applied for the measurement of the Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries as of any given date is the cost of debt for the Group (gross of the tax effect) that is adopted for the performance of Group impairment tests, as the cost of this debt is considered to be representative of the Group’s credit risk as of such date. The value of the Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries is subject to change over time as the exercise price of each put and call option and earn out arrangement is dependent on, among other things, the performance of the relevant company in a given future period, which could differ from the performance that we estimate when determining the value of the Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries for accounting purposes. Subsequent changes in the fair value of the Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries, due to both timing and possible changes in estimated indicators that form the basis for the computation of the consideration, are recognized in our consolidated statement of profit or loss, as is the case for the notional charges deriving from the gradual decrease of the effect of discounting. The discounted value of our Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries as of March 31, 2024, which is presented in our Unaudited Interim Financial Statements and in other sections of this Offering Memorandum, was €189.2 million (on a discounted basis) or €206.0 million (on a non-discounted basis). ----- See also “Risk factors—Risks related to our business—Certain of our subsidiaries have non controlling _shareholders whose interests may differ from our interests. In addition, the contractual arrangements with such non controlling shareholders may require us to purchase shares at predetermined prices under certain put and call options and to make payments under certain earn out arrangements”._ The following table summarizes the cash flows relating to our Liabilities to Non-Controlling Shareholders of Subsidiaries for the periods indicated.
