Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: HR & Payroll
Subsubsection Text: Offering payroll software solutions requires providers to be familiar with local language, labor regulations, market customs, and obtain necessary local and national accreditations. The lower end of the payroll market tends to be nearly fully outsourced to payroll professionals, as SMEs and micro businesess do not have the in-house knowledge to process the payslips and prefer to have an expert help them given the high complexity and high likelihood of mistakes. As customers grow in size, they tend to insource the payroll function again. As a result, payroll providers tend to offer either solutions for professionals, catering to smaller businesses, or solutions for enterprises catering to larger businesses. We believe we are market leaders in the former (payroll for professionals), but less dominant on the overall market (payroll for enterprises and professionals), where Zucchetti is market leader. We believe our payroll offering is differentiated by a high quality, well-priced offering. In addition, we also offer payroll processing services for some customers who want to outsource some of their payroll processing. We leverage AI and technology to reduce manual work needed and automatize the process to be able to offer this service at attractive price to our customers and with attractive margins for us. In Italy, there are a few international payroll providers (software and services) more skewed towards enterprise (e.g. ADP, SAP on the enterprise side; Workday does not have a payroll solution in Italy, although they are present with their HCM offering) and a few local Payroll providers (F2A on upper end of enterprise market, Zucchetti, WK, Inaz and others on the small and mid-size market). On HCM (employee records, talent management, time and attendance, etc.) instead, the offering is more standard, and it is less complex for providers to offer similar packages in different geographies. We perceive our value-add to be the ability to offer additional HCM modules, on top of an established payroll solution. We are strongly positioned with our established payroll solution, as we already largely control the customer’s payroll (which for smaller businesses tends to be the “master record” of their employee data), compared to other incumbents operating in the HCM space. In Italy there are a few international players (e.g. ADP, SAP on the enterprise side, factorial on the SME side) and a few local HCM providers (F2A on upper end of enterprise market, Zucchetti, WK, Inaz and others on the small and mid-size market). Across all HR software, Zucchetti is the leader in both HCM & payroll. We estimate our share to be approximately 7% in the HCM software segment (11% share when focusing only on SME and micro customer segments), and 22% in the Payroll segment (including software used by both enterprises and labor consultants, we have leading shares when focusing only on labor consultants).

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: CRM and Marketing Automation
Subsubsection Text: The CRM and marketing automation segment is mainly covered by international players (Shopify, Klaviyo, Mailchimp, Brevo), whereas local/Italian competition is comparatively weak. Our differentiating angle is that we offer an e-commerce/CRM unit which is integrated to our ERP/FMS solutions, functioning as a one-stop shop and single source for our customer (single customer record) and more integrated workflows (feedback loop between customer facing and rest of business). We currently have a strong positioning in Italy and the product can be easily exported internationally, especially where we already have ERP / FMS offering. We estimate our share to be 7% for extended CRM, based on revenues and 2023 market size (2023 CRM SAM: €411 million). -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Share and Segment Structure
Subsubsection Text: We believe we have established ourselves as one of the most competitive software providers in the ERP space in Italy. According to the Global Consulting Company Report, as of June 30, 2023, we held more than 30% share in Italy based on market value in the Micro business customer segment. According to IDC, we held a share based on numbers of seats of approximately 30% (compared to an approximate 23% combined share of our three closest competitors) and more than 30% (compared to an approximate 44% combined share of our three closest competitors) in the Italian Enterprise and Professional customer segments, respectively, as of the same date. _Micro_ Based on the most recently available data in 2023, the Italian ERP sector for micro businesses (0-9 employees) was fragmented, with the top three software providers behind TeamSystem accounting for approximately 26% of the market, based on number of seats. In this fragmented market, we have managed to gain a leadership position _vis-à-vis our competitors._ ----- Since our early entry in the Micro customer segment in 2019, we have built a strong customer base and achieved high client satisfaction, enabling us to grow our share above 30% between 2019 and the first half of 2023 (Global Consulting Company Report). Our comprehensive offering of innovative software solutions has allowed us to navigate the evolving Italian regulatory environment and establish our leadership position within this fragmented sector. We offer a comprehensive set of solutions on top of basic e-invoicing, which is very appealing to our micro customer base: from accounting and bookkeeping, to verticalized solutions (Spors, HoreCa), to marketing automation and digital finance. Our extensive product suite not only solidifies our share within our reference segments but also enhances customer loyalty and engagement. As a result, our closest top three competitors in this segment held a collective estimated share in the sector of approximately 26% as of June 30, 2023, underscoring our established leadership and the effectiveness of our first-mover advantage (Global Consulting Company Report). _Enterprise (Small (10-49 employees) and mid-size (50-499 employees))_ In 2023, the Italian ERP sector for Enterprises (10-499 employees) was fragmented, with the top three software providers behind TeamSystem accounting for approximately 20% of the market, based on number of seats. In this segment, we have managed to gain a leadership position vis-à-vis our competitors. We believe that we and other large Italian software providers are best positioned to take advantage of this sector due to several factors. Firms with greater resources can offer a wider range of services, cover a greater geographical reach and deliver consistent quality of customer support. Additionally, large national providers benefit from economies of scale in providing services and products to a large number of customers across and are able to invest higher resources in product research and development to keep up with technological innovation and regulatory evolution and to maintain their product offer aligned with state-of-the-art technology. Finally, customers are less likely to be concerned about the risk that their services will be discontinued when dealing with large providers. As a result, we have established ourselves as a clear leader in the Italian Enterprise (small and mid-size) customer segments. The remaining space is divided among numerous smaller ERP and FMS software providers. We do not compete with international software providers such as Microsoft and SAP as they target large and multinational enterprises, which are not our target customers. _Professional_ While the Italian professional customer segment is more stable and mature compared to the SMEs and micro businesses customer segment, large providers are still best positioned to take advantage of the fragmentation remaining in the market due to similar factors to those relevant to the SMEs and micro and small businesses customer segment. In addition, larger national and international firms are better placed to promptly implement software updates critical to professional services firms, such as those relating to changes in regulation or accounting standards. Moreover, superior brand recognition derived from being a key provider in this market may be leveraged to both attract new customers and retain existing customers. As a result of these factors, we have established our leading position across the professional customer segment.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: BUSINESS Overview
Subsubsection Text: - _In Cloud. Our In Cloud product line consists of cloud-based solutions tailored for micro and small businesses, enabling them to digitalize core processes such as invoicing, accounting, and customer relationship management, designed to provide a single point of contact, addressing their distinct operational needs. Our most successful software in this product line is Fatture in Cloud. - _Studio Cloud. Our Studio Cloud product line consists of mission-critical, comprehensive and scalable solutions for professionals, including accountants, law firms and CAFs. It integrates functionalities like financial statement management, payroll, and tax management into a single product suite. - _Enterprise Cloud. Our Enterprise Cloud product line provides a full suite of customizable ERP solutions designed to support mid-sized companies in their digital transformation journey. Such product line includes modules for digital accounting, cash management, inventory management and procurement and industry-specific features that cater to the unique needs of target segments, such as construction and fashion.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: BUSINESS Overview
Subsubsection Text: - _Digital Invoice. Our Digital Invoice product line is a cornerstone of our ERP and FMS platforms, offering a secure solution for creating, sending, receiving, and storing electronic invoices. It ensures full compliance with Italian regulatory frameworks, thereby playing a pivotal role in the rapidly evolving digital landscape, offering a comprehensive and integrated approach to managing daily invoicing tasks. - _Digital Finance. Our Digital Finance product line offers a comprehensive suite of solutions for digital payment, credit and rating services, enhancing working capital management and simplifying payment processes for SMBs and larger enterprises. - _Extended CRM. Our Extended CRM product line provides advanced tools for our small and mid-market customers to streamline their relationship management, marketing automation and e-commerce integration, helping businesses scale their operations and enhancing customer engagement. Extended CRM fully integrates with our ERP and FMS software, creating a unified, multi-channel and efficient business management ecosystem. - _HR Solutions. Our HR Solutions product line offers an integrated suite of digital tools for payroll and human resources management, catering to micro-small companies, SMBs, large enterprises, accountants and labor consultants. HR Solutions features full integration with our ERP and FMS software, ensuring streamlined operations and data consistency. ----- - _Trust Services. Our Trust Services product line enables secure, compliant digital operations through digital signatures, archiving and SPID access. Trust Services features full integration with our ERP and FMS software, ensuring streamlined operations and data consistency. Our total revenues from cross-selling platforms, which include most of our horizontal solutions (Digital Finance, Extended CRM, HR Solutions and Trust Services) for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024 accounted for €97.0 million. In order to provide our customers with best-in-class solutions to facilitate the digitalization of their processes, we have been integrating AI solutions and tools across our entire product suite to enhance automation, predictive capabilities and overall efficiency, thereby elevating customer experience and increasing productivity. Moreover, we have continuously evolved our product suite and underlying technologies. Based on our innovative SaaS platform, we have developed a comprehensive set of cloud-based software products that allowed us to penetrate the large segment of micro and small businesses customers in Italy, which have not historically utilized on premise software solutions mainly due to their relative complexity, enabling us to maintain a strong leadership position among accountants and mid-sized business customer. In addition, due to our technologically advanced and fully developed and integrated suite of digital products such as HR, Digital Signature, Digital Finance solutions, authentication, customer analytics and relationship management, we believe we are better positioned than our competitors to exploit the growing demand for digitalization solutions in both our Italian and international relevant sectors. We expect that the demand for digitalization solutions will continue to grow, driven by supportive regulations and incentives, as well as the need for customers to adapt to a changing environment that demands operational efficiency and automation. For example, in Italy we foresee potential opportunities from the upcoming tax reform on e-receipts which is expected to extend further than the current e-invoicing prescribed for businessto-business relationships. At an international level, we plan to benefit from the mandatory e-invoicing adoption in both Spain and Turkey. Set forth below is a graphic representing the interaction among our business units, product lines and target customers. _Source: Management analysis._

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: BUSINESS Overview
Subsubsection Text: We are the leading provider of cloud-based mission critical ERP, FMS and e-invoicing software for micro, small and mid-market businesses as well as professional customers in Italy, with a growing international presence, including in Spain and Turkey. Our mission is to improve the competitiveness of our customers, supporting them with the digitalization and automation of their internal and external business processes through our premium cloud-based product offering and solutions which also connect businesses, professionals and public administration organizations. Our products include software solutions for the core business processes of accountants and labor consultants (such as the provision of tax and accounting advice and payroll services) and a suite of financial management, accounting management, enterprise asset management, human capital management, production and supply chain management, administration and invoicing management and customer management software solutions, bolstered by AI and data analysis tools, for micro, small and mid-market businesses. We also offer onpremise solutions providing assistance and software maintenance services for all our products, nonetheless we actively support and transition our customers to cloud and SaaS native solutions, through a dual-track operating model to assist them in their transformation journey. Across industries, we embrace customer demand for digitalization solutions for business processes that, until recently, had not been automated or digitalized. Customers who utilize our integrated cloud-based solutions may digitally execute a variety of tasks, such as invoicing, document signing and other business management processes, which allows them to reduce their overall expenses and increase their business efficiency. Our easy-to-use integrated cloud-based software products have also enabled us to target micro business customers who have historically not utilized higher-functionality and more complex on premise business management software, and drive the digitalization shift for core business management processes. We believe we have established positions across all key segments in which we operate. As of June 30, 2023, we held an approximately 30% share in the small and mid-market businesses customer segment and more than 30% share in the professionals customer segment, in each case in Italy, based on number of seats (IDC). In addition, according to the Global Consulting Company Report, we held more than 30% share in the micro businesses customer segment in terms of value over the same period. As of June 30, 2023, we had a growing or established presence in the sectors in which we operate, including Digital Finance, HCM, payroll and industry-specific sectors, with shares of up to 22% in some of these segments. Moreover, as of June 30, 2023, our strategic operations and leadership enabled us to achieve a share of approximately 4% in Spain and approximately 14% in Turkey, based on revenue generated within these sectors divided by the estimated SAM of each sector and expressed as a percentage thereof, thus successfully establishing our presence in these growing sectors. We offer our products and services through six main business units: - Professional Solutions. Our Professional Solutions business unit includes software for professionals, including accountants, and labor consultants, including accounting, payroll, billing and compliance tools. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, our Professional Solutions business unit accounted for 28.3% of our total revenue. - Micro Solutions. Our Micro Solutions business unit includes cloud-based products designed for micro and small business customers (0-9 employees and 10-49 employees, respectively), such as Fatture in Cloud, Contabilità in Cloud and Cassa in Cloud. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, our Micro Solutions business unit accounted for 27.2% of our total revenue. - Enterprise Solutions. Our Enterprise Solutions business unit includes ERP and FMS software for midmarket business customers (10-500 employees), including administration, finance, human resources, sales, supply chain management and production. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2024 our Enterprise Solutions business unit accounted for 22.0% of our total revenue. - Market Specific Solutions. Our Market Specific Solutions business unit includes products and services designed to address the needs of customers in specific industries, such as, among others, mechanical and manufacturing, construction, CAF/public sectors and legal, and the needs for all business sizes from micro to mid-size. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, our Market Specific Solutions business unit accounted for 12.9% of our total revenue. ----- - Cross Segment Product Solutions. Our Cross Segment Product Solutions offers HR and Trust solutions, including digital signature, archive and digital identity services, which are fully integrated with our ERP systems. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, our Cross Segment Product Solutions business unit accounted for 6.8% of our total revenue. - Digital Finance Solutions. Our Digital Finance Solutions business unit includes digital financial valueadded services designed to streamline financial operations of our customers and address their needs, such as rating services, credit management and digital payment solutions. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, our Digital Finance Solutions business unit accounted for 2.8% of our total revenue. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, we generated total revenue and Adjusted EBITDA of €778.7 million (compared to €423 million for the year ended December 31, 2020) and €334.8 million (compared to €209 million for the year ended December 31, 2020), respectively. The following chart sets forth our total revenue breakdown by business unit for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, we generated 83.5% of our total revenue from recurring sources, which are primarily related to annual software assistance and maintenance contracts, annual subscription contracts, annual fees from our multi-year contracts with VARs and fees from temporary annual licenses (licenze _temporanee annuali) that we sell to our customers whenever the Italian government introduces a new regulatory_ obligation (e.g., a new tax digital reporting obligation or tax payment) that requires a dedicated feature to be added to our software products (we refer to such temporary annual licenses as “Regulatory LTAs”). We believe that our technology leadership, significant and ongoing expansion of our cloud-based solutions, the mission-critical nature of our products and the overall willingness of our customers to renew their contracts have contributed, and will continue to contribute, to our high annual subscription contracts and renewal rates. Most of our products are deeply integrated into our end-customers’ IT systems and business processes, and their replacement is normally a complicated, time-consuming and expensive process, requiring extensive training for users. In addition, our digital and cloud-based solutions platform, Digital Invoice, designed to operate across all our digital products, is integrated with all our ERP solutions and allows our customers to digitally send, receive, register and store electronic invoices from and to private customers, companies, public entities, banks and external accountants and to send tax filings to the relevant tax authorities electronically. Our three key customer groups are micro and small businesses, mid-market businesses and professionals, which are located both in Italy and abroad. Our end-customer base, including VAR’s end-customers, increased from approximately 88,000 as of December 31, 2009 to approximately 2.1 million as of December 31, 2023. Of this total figure, approximately 87.7% are micro and small businesses, approximately 8.6% are mid-market businesses and approximately 3.7% are professionals. Our large and diverse customer base is highly fragmented and diversified in terms of size and geography. As of December 31, 2023, we had approximately 276 thousand customers outside of Italy, our ten largest customers generated 5.0% of our total revenue, while our 50 largest customers and 200 largest customers generated 10.4% and 15.3%, respectively. Our customer base is also spread across a variety of industries, including accountancy, labor advisory, manufacturing, industrial, construction, wellness, hospitality, fashion, retail, distribution, food and beverage, legal and other professional services sectors. We have strategically internalized our VARs to establish stronger and more direct relationships with our customer base. This approach allows us to provide personalized and seamless services, enhancing customer satisfaction and loyalty. Such approach also supports our upselling initiatives, offering tailored solutions that meet the evolving needs of our clients and aiding them in the continuing transition to cloud solutions. Through these efforts, we ensure our clients benefit from the latest technological advancements while maintaining our competitive edge in the field. In furtherance of our internalization strategy, we have continued to pursue a series of bolt-on acquisitions ----- to bolster our competitive position, expand our product offerings and continue our international expansion. In recent years, we expanded into Spain by acquiring a controlling interest in the Spanish start-up Billin and consolidated our presence in the country by acquiring Software del Sol. In 2023, we further expanded our portfolio with acquisitions such as Acumbamail and Aplifisa, and entered the Turkish sector by acquiring the Mikro group. Lastly, in 2024, we entered into an acquisition agreement with the French ERP software provider to continue expand our presence outside of Italy. Our acquisitions have contributed positively to our revenue growth, product and business mix diversification. This acquisition strategy is key to our growth plan, driving sustained expansion and reinforcing our leadership in the sector. We implemented a series of nominal price increases across our customer segments. In the micro and small businesses customer segment, prices were raised by a total of 10 percentage points from 2021 to 2023, due to a high inflationary environment. In the mid-market segment, we saw a nominal price increase of 3.8 percentage points from 2020 to 2023, while in the professionals customer segment, also from 2020 to 2023, prices increased by 7.0 percentage points over the same period. During these periods, we also observed changes in customer churn. In the micro and small businesses segment, churn decreased by 0.2 percentage points between 2021 and 2023. The mid-market segment experienced a slight 0.5 percentage points churn increase between 2020 and 2023, and in the professionals customer segment, churn decreased by 1.8 percentage points from 2020 to 2023. We divide our product offering into the following three product suites and five horizontal solutions:

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our strengths
Subsubsection Title: Large and growing segments benefitting from secular digitalization with regulatory tailwinds and significant investments and expertise requirements
Subsubsection Text: We offer both cloud solutions (SaaS and IaaS) and on-premises solutions, in each case across sizeable and attractive sectors both in Italy and internationally, which offer substantial growth opportunities mainly supported by regulatory tailwinds, operational complexities and considerable initial investments. While Italy remains our core segment, we have entered the Spanish segment in 2020 in which we further consolidated our position in 2023 through the acquisition of Acumbamail and Aplifisa, as well as the Turkish segment, where in 2023 we acquired MikroGrup, a leading local player. As a leading player in the ERP sector in Italy, Spain and Turkey, we believe we are well-positioned to leverage the favorable conditions and expected trends in these countries to drive growth and expand our competitive presence. ----- As December 31, 2023, our total SAM was estimated to be worth approximately €5.8 billion (approximately €11.5 billion of TAM), growing at an expected CAGR of approximately 9% between 2023 and 2027. Our SAM has grown over time, from approximately €1.1 billion in 2016, to approximately €5.8 billion in 2023, due to the growth of our core Italian ERP sector and entry into new segments such as HR, Digital Finance and CRM and automation, as well as new geographies such as Spain and Turkey. Moreover, the SAM is expected to further grow to approximately €8.3 billion in 2027. These SAM figures include also the International ERP and FMS sectors in Spain and Turkey, which are estimated to be worth approximately €1.0 billion (€3.2 billion TAM) in 2023 and are expected to growth at a CAGR of approximately 12% between 2023 and 2027. Our SAM has significantly expanded via both geographic reach and product diversification, making it less susceptible to macroeconomic fluctuations. Historically, our SAM has demonstrated robust resilience through various economic cycles, including the financial crises of 2009 and 2012, as well as the COVID-19 pandemic, consistently outperforming Italy’s GDP growth. This resilience is further reinforced by our strategic focus and successful repositioning initiatives in high-growth segments, such as micro and digital finance. _Source: Global Consulting Company Report for Italy, Management analysis for Spain and Turkey, International Monetary Fund, World Economic Outlook Database, April 2024, for GDP. Note: Chart displays organic SAM growth, assuming a like-for-like perimeter year over year._ We believe there is still significant whitespace to benefit from, equivalent to the difference between SAM and TAM, which we expect to target by expanding our product offering and increasing customer reach, thereby targeting client segments currently not covered or not served with specific propositions. The ERP sector in Italy, Spain, and Turkey are expected to experience continued growth, propelled by regulatorydriven tailwinds, ongoing digitalization, increased ERP software adoption across all customer sizes, and the transition to cloud-based solutions. These factors result in us being well placed to further benefit from our competitive positions and capitalize on emerging opportunities. _Italy_ In Italy, the main drivers for growth are stable demand, regulatory tailwinds, digitalization and ERP uptake, cloud transition, cybersecurity concerns and growing adoption of generative AI. We believe we are well positioned to capitalize on these trends and further expand our presence across our reference segments. The Italian ERP software market is characterized by operational complexities and considerable initial investments, particularly for international competitors, due to cultural and local commercial complexities. These include language barriers, complex payroll rules, local accounting standards (Italian GAAP), and evolving regulatory constraints in key sectors like banking, energy, and healthcare. These complexities favor local and regional players, allowing us to capitalize on our leading position in the field. Our deep knowledge of the domestic ----- landscape and long-standing relationships with a wide cross-section of Italian customers and partners further strengthen our competitive advantage. In 2021, local and regional players held a combined 55% share, compared to an average of 25% in other EU countries, as shown in the chart below. _Source: Global Consulting Company Report._ ERP solutions are fundamental to the day-to-day activities of businesses, especially as the operations of Italian enterprises become increasingly complex. This complexity drives demand for a broader range of innovative management solutions to monitor key activities. Accounting and payroll management software remain core due to stringent Italian regulations requiring digital fiscal and labor filings. Our state-of-the-art cloud-based solutions ensure compliance with these demanding and ever-changing regulatory requirements, providing seamless support even in light of changing regulations. This allows our customers to focus on their core activities without diverting pivotal resources, ensuring stable demand and revenues for our mission-critical services. The ongoing digitalization trend in Italy is primarily driven by stringent regulatory requirements, which impose significant fiscal and administrative burdens on companies and create a strong demand for up-to-date management software that streamlines administrative functions and establishes operational complexities and considerable initial investments for new competitors. We are well-positioned to meet this demand by providing products and updates that help clients ensure regulatory compliance. Subsidies introduced over the past few years, such as the “Industry 4.0” initiative, which offers financial vouchers to promote the digitalization of SMEs and micro and small businesses, and the National Recovery and Resilience Plan (Piano Nazionale di Ripresa e Resilienza), which allocates approximately €40 billion for digitalization projects across the public sector, further incentivize digitalization in Italy. Moreover, the increasing role of European ESG regulations, such as the CSRD, is expected to drive demand for ESG software solutions. These regulations require standardized ESG disclosures from both large enterprises and SMBs, creating a need for sophisticated compliance tools. Our expertise and comprehensive product offerings uniquely position us to help businesses navigate these regulatory landscapes, consolidating our competitive position leadership and expanding our customer base. The Italian market is also poised to benefit from government policies, incentives, and subsidies that promote digitalization. Italy demonstrates strong performance in the adoption of cloud services, with approximately 50% of enterprises utilizing this technology, significantly surpassing the EU average of 34%. Unlike other Mediterranean countries, Italy’s penetration rates for cloud services more closely resemble those of Nordic and Benelux economies, which have historically been more advanced in terms of digitalization. ----- The chart below shows the digitalization rate of EU countries as of December 31, 2023[(1)]: _Source: Digital economy and society index (DESI); 2023 Indicators, data from 2021._ Note: “Enterprise with Clouds Solutions” represents enterprises which have adopted at least one of the following cloud solutions: finance or accounting software applications; ERP software applications; CRM software applications; security software applications; hosting the enterprise’s database(s); computing platform providing a hosted environment for application development, testing or deployment. Furthermore, approximately 70% of SMEs in Italy have at least a basic level of digital intensity, just above the EU average of 69%, and well above other Mediterranean countries such as France and Spain. Progress in digitalization in Italy is especially pronounced in the use of e-invoices, where Italy outperforms the European average, being one of the first countries to make e-invoices mandatory for all companies, regardless of size. This strong adoption of cloud services and digital tools underscores the readiness of Italian enterprises to embrace digital transformation, further driving demand for our advanced ERP and FMS solutions. _Source: Digital economy and society index (DESI) 2023 Indicators, data from 2022. The digital intensity score is based on counting how many of twelve selected technologies are used by enterprises. A basic level requires usage of at least four technologies._ Despite the above, the Italian market is considered to be still at the early stages of its digital transformation journey. While it has achieved a nearly 100% adoption rate for e-invoicing software across companies of all sizes, driven by government regulations, there remain substantial growth opportunities for ERP, CRM and business intelligence software, especially among micro and small-sized businesses where the adoption rate is currently below 30%. ----- The chart below shows the software adoption rate by company size as of December 31, 2023 _Source: ISTAT report imprese 2023._ Lastly, within the global cloud market, the ERP sector is less penetrated than other functional markets. Adoption of cloud-based ERP software has been slower compared to financial applications and performance software, which remain predominantly on-premise. This contrasts with the CRM and HCM sectors, where the transition to cloudbased technology has been quicker. The slower adoption rate of ERP systems is due to their mission-critical nature and the increased need for customization compared to CRM and HCM systems. However, cloud adoption in the Italian ERP sector has been steadily increasing, with penetration expected to reach approximately 48% of the market in 2023 and continue to rise thereafter. We believe this additional trend presents a significant opportunity for us to expand our cloud-based ERP offerings and capture a growing share. The ever-increasing demand for cybersecurity is also a significant growth driver, with cyber attacks rising dramatically across all industries. In 2022, global cyber attacks increased by 21.5% compared to 2021, and Italy saw a staggering 170% increase, making it the fourth most targeted country. Many attacks result from human error, highlighting the need for better technology training and simple software solutions. With low current SMB adoption of cybersecurity software, there is a substantial growth opportunity for products dedicated to cyber risks mitigation. We believe the EU Cybersecurity SMB software TAM, which was worth approximately €12 billion in 2022, is expected to grow by 12% between 2022 and 2024. By offering and integrating robust cybersecurity features into our ERP and FMS solutions, we can enhance our value proposition and consolidated our position within the sector. Furthermore, the availability of new technology, such as advanced machine learning and generative AI, is a crucial growth driver. The AI sector, which includes software, hardware, and services, is projected to grow at a CAGR of 18% between 2020 and 2025, with software being the dominant segment. Success in the ERP space will depend on leveraging generative AI for internal efficiency and integrating it into customer solutions. In Italy, AI awareness is increasing, with many professionals recognizing it as a key trend and considering AI products to enhance efficiency and productivity. Our significant investments in Data and AI position us to meet our customers’ evolving needs, offering advanced AI-infused business applications that drive efficiency and productivity, thereby strengthening our competitive edge. _Spain_ We believe that, similar to Italy, growth in the Spanish ERP sector is driven by regulatory changes, increasing digitalization, and the transition to cloud-based solutions. Regulation in Spain plays an active role in sustaining our sector dynamics. Key regulatory trends expected to positively impact the ERP sector in Spain include grants and subsidies, tax level changes, accounting software standard enforcement, and mandatory e-invoicing. Spain is making notable progress in digital technology integration, particularly through initiatives targeting the digitalization of SMEs and the self-employed. These efforts are driving the growth in the ERP sector and increasing the demand for advanced accounting software due to potential fiscal complexities from ongoing tax rate debates and heightened standards following recent data breaches. The shift from voluntary to mandatory einvoicing, set to be compulsory for small and micro-enterprises by 2026 and for larger enterprises by 2024, is a key growth driver. Despite SMEs’ digitalization levels being slightly below the EU average, the Spanish government’s investments in digitalization present significant growth opportunities, not only enhancing SMEs’ capabilities but also impacting ICT specialists, infrastructure, and digital public services. Additionally, measures to boost cloud computing adoption are underway, addressing the current lag behind the European average. ----- Key growth drivers in Spain over the next few years include strong upsell and cross-sell opportunities, with a significant increase in average revenue per customer expected, and a rapid shift to cloud-based services. Cloud penetration is expected to grow substantially across segments, including accountants and small to mid-sized companies. With a deep understanding of the market and a comprehensive suite of ERP and FMS solutions, we believed we are strategically positioned to harness these trends, meeting the evolving needs of the Spanish segment. _Turkey_ Similar to Italy and Spain, growth in the Turkish ERP sector is expected to be driven by regulatory changes and increased digitalization. The Turkish government has worked towards combating the shadow economy by establishing online systems for real-time tracking and auditing. Key initiatives such as e-integration, mandatory online salary payments, and enhanced auditing systems are expected to sustain growth within the ERP sector. Current regulations require companies with a certain level of turnover to comply with e-invoicing regulations, and the inflationary environment in Turkey is likely to increase the number of companies falling within this threshold, therefore expanding the sector.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our strengths
Subsubsection Title: Long-standing leadership position with a strong track record of growth in targeted customer segments
Subsubsection Text: We believe we have achieved a leading position across our customer segments, product offering and key geographies. In terms of customers, our leading position spans across the Italian micro and small businesses customer segment (“Micro”), in terms of value, which mainly refers to FMS solutions for micro enterprise (including e-invoicing, accounting software and POS systems), mid-market business customer segment (“Enterprise”) in terms of number of seats, which refer to the segment for ERP software for SMEs, and professional customer segment (“Professional”), in terms of number of seats, which comprises accountants and labor and tax advisors. According to the Global Consulting Company Report, as of June 30, 2023, we held more than 30% share in Italy based on market value in the Micro business customer segment. According to IDC, we held a share based on numbers of seats of approximately 30% (compared to an approximately 23% combined share of our three closest competitors) and more than 30% (compared to an approximately 44% combined share of our three closest competitors) in the Italian Enterprise and Professional customer segments, respectively, as of the same date. Our leading position in Italy across our customer segments is the result of many years of developing our proprietary software through significant investment, which has established our reputation for high-quality and reliable products and services in such segments. Since our early entry in the Micro customer segment in 2019, we have built a strong customer base and achieved high client satisfaction, enabling us to grow our share above 30% in terms number of seats between 2019 and the first half of 2023 (Global Consulting Company Report). Our comprehensive offering of innovative software solutions has allowed us to navigate the evolving Italian regulatory environment and establish our leadership position within this fragmented sector. Our extensive product suite not only solidifies our share within our reference segments but also enhances customer loyalty and engagement. As a result, our closest top three competitors in this segment held a collective estimated share in the sector of approximately 26.0% as of June 30, 2023, underscoring our established leadership and the effectiveness of our first-mover advantage (Global Consulting Company Report). In the Enterprise customer segment, we have achieved a clear leadership position, underpinned by our mission to support SMEs in their digital transformation and to improve their efficiency and competitiveness while ensuring compliance with the Italian regulatory framework. Our ability to offer a wide range of services has enabled us to benefit from significant economies of scale. Our integrated and customizable platform of solutions allow us to address the needs of companies across selected verticals, reinforcing our leadership and driving sustained growth. The Professional customer segment is relatively more stable and mature compared to other segments. Our leadership in this segment, which we have maintained since 2019, is underpinned by superior brand recognition, supported by a loyal customer base and delivery of high-quality, reliable and integrated software solutions, which ensures that we remain the preferred choice for professional customers, further consolidating our competitive position. In terms of product offering, we believe to have achieved a promising position in key product segments such as Digital Finance, human resources solutions and certain industry-specific segments. In particular, in the Digital Finance segment we see significant opportunities to further expand our product offerings and increase our ----- competitive presence. Holding less than 1% share in 2023, as a percentage of SAM, there is a high potential for revenue generation in the Digital Finance segment. In the human resources solutions segment, which encompasses HCM and payroll software, we achieved an approximately 7% share in the HCM segment, and an approximately 22% share in the payroll segment, in each case as of June 30, 2023. Furthermore, as of June 30, 2023, we held an approximately 22% share for CAD/CAM solutions and an approximately 7% for Extended CRM and marketing automation. With regards to our geographic sector, we believe we are a leading player in Italy in the ERP sector. In addition, we also operate in attractive segments outside of Italy. Our international expansion began in 2020 with acquisitions in Spain, followed by Turkey in 2022. These strategic moves have significantly increased our presence and influence in these key segments. For our international segment, mainly comprising ERP software solutions for Spain and Turkey, the SAM and TAM amounted to approximately €1.0 billion and approximately €3.2 billion, respectively, as of June 30, 2023. Our strategic operations and experienced leadership enabled us to achieve a share of approximately 4% in Spain, which increased from approximately 2% in 2020, and an approximately 14% share in Turkey, based on revenue generated within these segments divided by the estimated SAM of each segment and expressed as a percentage thereof for the same period. These results underscore our rapid development of influence and competitive edge in these segments.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our strengths
Subsubsection Title: Comprehensive product suite for SMBs and professionals enabling cross-sell, up-sell, and broader ecosystem benefits
Subsubsection Text: Our product offering is carefully designed to cater to the diverse requirements of our customers, providing cloudbased solutions that are customized for businesses of different sizes and needs. Our offering includes, among others, specialized state-of-the-art features that increase operational efficiency and advanced analytics, bolstered by AI tools and capabilities. Our integrated cloud-based offering enables customer collaboration and allows us to implement cross-selling initiatives for various solutions. As indicated below, certain of our products within our comprehensive offering are dedicated to specific clusters of customers, while certain others are typically available for our entire customer platform. _Source: Management analysis._ Our range of cloud products, part of an integrated platform and vertical solutions, empowers customers to digitalize core processes such as quoting, billing, managing customer relationships and streamlining business monitoring. These offerings feature an intuitive, user-friendly interface, regularly enhanced through updates to ensure reliability, efficiency and ease of use. This continuous improvement cycle keeps our solutions at the forefront of technological advancements, providing customers with cutting-edge tools to stay competitive while ----- ensuring compliance with applicable laws. This translates into up-selling opportunities and increased high-quality revenues, as most of our solutions generate recurring revenues. Our leading integrated cloud application suite has enabled us to secure a substantial customer base, which we aim to further expand by exploiting new opportunities, such as the ongoing digitalization and regulatory tailwinds as well as through cross-selling initiatives. Most of our products and services are offered across our micro and small businesses, professional and mid-market businesses customer segments. A notable example is our Digital Invoice solution. This mission-critical solution is essential for companies adopting e-invoicing, driven by regulatory mandates. In 2023, our Digital Invoice solution supported over 480 million invoices, representing an aggregate value of approximately €1,050 billion and assisted around 2.0 million customers with Digital Invoice applications. Our Digital Invoice applications offer security and reliability, crucial for managing daily invoicing digitally. We have been successful at up-selling our products and expanding our customer base through value-added solutions. In addition, we benefit from our customer base beyond invoicing and accounting to cross-sell our Digital Finance, CRM in Cloud, HR and Trust solutions, which generated approximately €100 million in revenues for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024. We believe these solutions have further opportunity to expand within our customer base as our customer product penetration is below approximately 4%. This holistic approach offered to companies and accountants in a user-friendly and cost-efficient manner enhances customer satisfaction, retention and lifetime value. Furthermore, our SaaS platform integrates advanced analytics and AI capabilities, positioning us well to leverage data monetization and AI as key drivers for growth and differentiation. By expanding our offerings with new datacentric products, including tools for aggregated data and benchmarking, we have implemented data-driven approaches to enhance our business operations and product offerings. AI integration enabled us to develop solutions that reduce manual tasks, such as proposing accounting codes, thereby improving efficiency and user experience. We are committed to enabling our customers to utilize data and AI for their business needs, providing insights into cost management and business intelligence. For example, our AI and automated accounting module available for our professional customers transforms our software into a proactive and predictive tool for managing routine tasks. Our investments in data and AI are designed to achieve several key objectives: (i) collecting and measuring data to enhance our data platforms and governance; (ii) creating an AI platform to support new use cases with generative AI and machine learning; (iii) developing AI tools such as virtual assistants to support customer activities; and (iv) fostering a data-driven culture within our customers’ organizations to improve cross-business coordination. These initiatives are aimed at maintaining our competitive edge and delivering exceptional value to our customers. AI features enhance customer interaction and support through a virtual assistant, customer assistant AI tool, Invoice Insights, and banks-to-invoice matching, thereby improving efficiency and accuracy. These innovations position us as a leader in the integration of AI within ERP, providing our customers with unparalleled capabilities to streamline their operations and make data-driven decisions.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our strengths
Subsubsection Title: Well invested, leading SaaS platform, enabling product innovation and future growth
Subsubsection Text: Since our establishment in 1979, we have consistently adapted to technological advancements, evolving from onpremises solutions to a market-leading SaaS platform. In 2014, we became one of the first companies in Italy to invest in cloud products, which allowed us to gain a significant competitive advantage in the Italian business management software sector. By 2015, we started developing an integrated SaaS platform with extensive application programing interfaces and a strong emphasis on UX and user interface design, positioning ourselves swiftly as a center of excellence. We believe that our SaaS platform excels through its comprehensive approach to cross-selling end-to-end digitalization services, benefiting from high-level services, such as Digital Finance, Trust Services, and marketing automation, shared across multiple customer segments to enhance value and efficiency. By incorporating lowlevel utilities shared across the platform and focusing on front-end/UX enhancements, workflow optimizations, dedicated modules, and end-to-end integration, we deliver a seamless and intuitive user experience. Additionally, a common data repository supports our integrated approach, ensuring data consistency, accuracy and accessibility. Cloud products accounted for 48.5% of our revenue for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, compared to 40% in the year ended December 31, 2021. As of March 31, 2024, we had successfully transitioned approximately 92% of our customers to at least one cloud solution, underscoring our leadership in the sector. ----- Our platform integrates advanced analytics and AI to drive growth and differentiation. We use data-driven approaches to enhance operations and products and automating and reducing manual tasks. Our AI investments focus on creating an AI platform for generative AI and machine learning, developing tools like virtual assistants, enhancing data platforms and governance, and fostering a data-driven culture for better cross-business coordination. Our ongoing investments in R&D, contributing to our continuous growth, are crucial for transforming our products to meet the diverse needs of our large and diversified customer base and increasing our recurring revenue through regular upgrades and price adjustments. In particular, between 2020 and 2023, we invested an average of €60 million per year in R&D activities, excluding cloud and infrastructure costs. As of March 31, 2024, our commitment to innovation was supported by approximately 1,200 software engineers managing over 100 million lines of code. We believe that our consistent focus on innovation, as exemplified by our advanced and continuously evolving SaaS platform, positions us well for continued growth and differentiation.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our strengths
Subsubsection Title: Large, highly diversified and fragmented customer base characterized by high retention rates
Subsubsection Text: From 2015 to 2023, our end customer base, excluding VARs’ end customers, increased at a CAGR of 30.8%, growing from approximately 200,000 customers to approximately 2,105,000 customers, of which 1,850,000 were micro and small businesses, 80,000 were professionals and 180,000 were mid-market businesses. Our Net Revenue Retention rate reached 106% as of December 31, 2023, demonstrating our ability to drive organic revenue growth within our existing customer base. This strong retention rate highlights the value and effectiveness of our solutions, fostering long-term customer loyalty and consistent revenue growth. We believe these results underscore the exceptional value and satisfaction our customers derive from our products and services, as well as our ability to drive top-line revenue growth from our existing customers. Our customer base is large, diversified and fragmented, which mitigates risks related to declines in product demand in any one particular industry and reduces reliance on revenues from a small number of key customers. For the year ended December 31, 2023, our ten largest customers generated 5.0% of our total revenue, while our 50 largest customers and 200 largest customers generated 10.4% and 15.3%, respectively, over the same period. We also do not have any major single industry exposure, while keeping a significant contribution from resilient sectors and low exposure to industries typically more affected by macroeconomic disruptions (e.g., restaurants, bars and catering, hospitality, tour operators and travel agencies). The chart below sets forth our current customer concentration by sectors for the year ended December 31, 2023.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Customers breakdown by industry** **(%)
Subsubsection Text: _Source: Management analysis._ (1) Excludes approximately 8% of “Other industries”, which includes, amongst others, transport, agriculture, education and other industries. ----- Our commitment to delivering exceptional products and services is reflected in our consistently high NPS across all industries in which we operate. NPS, a metric used to calculate customer satisfaction, represents the percentage of customers rating their likelihood to recommend our products to others. It is measured as the sum of the percentage of promoters (loyal customers, repeat buyers, and those most likely to promote our business willingly) less the percentage of detractors (customers unlikely to buy our products again). Our high NPS indicates that our products not only generate high customer satisfaction but also maintain such satisfaction consistently across diverse sectors. Our NPS also demonstrates the universal appeal and reliability of our offerings. This level of customer advocacy also contributes to our sustained growth and competitive advantage, highlighting that our products resonate well with a wide range of customers and industry needs. The table below shows our growing NPS levels from the last quarter of the year ended December 31, 2022 to the last quarter of the year ended December 31, 2023. _Source: Nielsen._ We have historically experienced high and stable Customer Retention Rates. For the years ended December 31, 2021, 2022 and 2023, we have experienced high and stable Customer Retention Rates of approximately (i) 90.3%, 90.0% and 90.7, respectively, for micro and small business customers; (ii) 90.7%, 92.5% and 91.8%, respectively, for mid-market business customers; and (iii) 91.7%, 93% and 92.8%, respectively, for professionals. Customer Retention Rate for micro and small businesses customers is typically slightly lower than Customer Retention Rate for mid-market customers and professionals due to the lower switching costs associated with solutions for micro and small business, mainly as a result of their lower level of complexity, and frequent business lifecycle changes within this segment. We believe that the mission-critical nature of our software products and services, which are deeply embedded in many of our customers’ workflows and IT systems, has historically provided a degree of insulation from economic uncertainties and resulted in our high Customer Retention Rates. Our customers’ operations depend upon our products to facilitate data flow, not only in-house, with respect to internal business management data analysis and storage, but also externally, between our customers and other businesses or between our customers, banks, tax authorities and other public administration organizations. In addition, our high Customer Retention Rate is also supported by our customers’ satisfaction and overall willingness to renew their subscriptions. In particular, mid-market and professional customers tend to carefully consider the migration to alternative software providers in light of, among others,: (i) the mission-critical nature of software and the possibility that customers may be exposed to data migration risk during a transition to an alternative supplier; (ii) the cost and length of time required to transition to an alternative platform given that ERP systems are integral to the various operational segments of an organization; and (iii) the training required to familiarize employees with new software. Moreover, for the professionals customer segment, we believe the adoption of our digital ancillary solutions allows a strong connection and digital interrelation between our professional customers and their endcustomers, making our professional customers more dependent on our products in their day-to-day activities, which, in turn, incentivizes our customers to continue using our products and not to switch to competitors’ solutions. Our NPS for each of our Professional, Enterprise Solutions, Market Specific Solutions and Micro Solutions business units has shown a positive trend over the last four years. This positive trend, as illustrated in the chart below, underscores our ability to consistently deliver value and satisfaction to our customers, further solidifying our position as a leader in Italy. -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Nominal price increase** **Churn [(1)]
Subsubsection Title: Best-in-class business model and financial profile, with predictable and resilient organic revenue growth, increasing profitability with strong cashflow conversion
Subsubsection Text: We have achieved remarkable growth over the past 15 years with strong acceleration after 2000. In particular, between the year ended December 31, 2021, and the year ended December 31, 2023, our organic total revenue, calculated as our total revenue less the revenue from acquired companies, grew at an average annual rate of 10.0%. Moreover, our performance has consistently outpaced the Italian GDP growth, even during challenging economic periods such as the 2009 and 2012 financial crises and the COVID-19 pandemic. In 2012, amidst the global financial crisis, Italy’s GDP declined by 2.8%, while we achieved organic revenue growth of 1.7%, outperforming the Italian GDP by 4.5 percentage points. Similarly, in 2020, when the Italian GDP declined compared to 2019, we achieved 7.3% organic revenue growth, outperforming the Italian GDP by 16.0 percentage points, mainly due to the successful launch of our e-invoicing products and the strong demand for these solutions underpinned by COVID-19 dynamics. In 2022 and 2023, we outperformed the Italian GDP by 5.9% and 10.9%, respectively, underscoring our continuous and outstanding growth across adverse economic cycles. The following chart presents a comparison of our organic revenue growth and the Italian GDP growth for each year between 2009 and 2023:

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: TeamSystem Group Organic Revenue Growth (YoY %)[1 ]
Subsubsection Title: Successful and disciplined bolt-on M&A strategy, with proven playbook of acquiring high quality, accretive opportunities
Subsubsection Text: Our historical acquisition strategy has successfully enabled us to expand our business across customers, segments, geographic areas and product offerings. Our proven integration playbook has consistently enabled us to achieve revenue and cost synergies, in the form of cross-selling and upselling for the former and in the form of workforce and real estate rationalization, procurement centralization and other product (for example, the use of Group ----- developer pool, architecture and UX) synergies for the latter. We have been able to achieve for the cohorts acquired between 2011 and 2023 an average revenue CAGR between 15% and 20% and an EBITDA margin expansion between 14 and 16 percentage points, in each case post acquisition. The main goals we have pursued with the latest acquisitions, and intend to continue pursuing, relate to the following main areas: - _product and capabilities enhancement: we have strategically acquired selected startups, software houses, and individual business units to enhance our opportunity to cross-sell and expand our presence in the segments served by these entities; these acquisitions aim at reducing our time-to-market for the launch of new cloud-based and industry specific solutions, providing us with an advantage over our competitors and allowing us to internalize relevant competences and expertise on innovative technologies and products (e.g., solutions for e-mail and SMS marketing as well as technical software for the construction and engineering sectors); - _international expansion: in recent years, we have completed several acquisitions to expand our footprint outside of Italy. This includes selected acquisitions in Spain, where new e-invoicing regulations are expected to be gradually implemented in the coming years, and we anticipate strong digitalization trends and growth potential, particularly in the micro and small business customer segment. Additionally, we have acquired a leading player in Turkey, a geographic area which comprises over 3 million enterprises with high growth and digitalization potential; and - _VARs insourcing: we have acquired and we intend to continue acquiring our VARs. By doing so, we aim to establish strong and direct relationships with our customers, further support our upselling initiatives and continue their transition to cloud solutions. We have a dedicated team focused on the integration of acquired companies and we have developed a disciplined and structured approach to plan and execute all activities required to successfully integrate and extract revenue and cost synergies from acquired companies. In particular, the integration process involves all aspects of the acquired businesses, including finance, cybersecurity, compliance, data protection, reporting, personnel, procurement, facility management, R&D, product integration, marketing and sales and the definition of the value proposition and go-to-market approach for the newly acquired and integrated products. We have made a number of selected and, we believe, highly strategic bolt-on acquisitions over the past few years which we believe have contributed to our success. In particular, over the years, we have developed a structured process to integrate the acquired entities through a well-developed process which spans from three to 24 months, depending on the features and complexities of the deal. Between 2021 and 2022 we have been able to successfully complete a series of bolt-on acquisitions which allowed us to expand and consolidate our presence in terms of product offering and geography. In 2023, we further expanded our portfolio with key acquisitions, including MailUp, a marketing automation platform, and GreeNext, a software developer for waste management. Additionally, we strengthened our presence in Spain by acquiring Acumbamail and Aplifisa, and entered Turkey by acquiring the Mikro group, enhancing our offerings in marketing, accounting, and ERP solutions. Furthermore, we believe that the acquisitions we made have generated revenue synergies. Such acquisitions gave us, for example, the ability to increase our brand recognition internationally, cross-sell and up-sell the products that we acquired to our existing customer base and to enrich our product offering in key strategic areas (e.g., marketing automation with Mail-Up, e-commerce with Storeden, GreenNext for waste management solutions and Beneficy Welfare to enrich our HR platform).

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: TeamSystem Group Organic Revenue Growth (YoY %)[1 ]
Subsubsection Title: Strong focus on sustainability initiatives to reduce our environmental impact, supporting our people while ensuring a sustainable governance model
Subsubsection Text: We are committed to continuous improvement and operational excellence, with a focus on sustainability, employee well-being, and robust governance practices. We are dedicated to achieving ambitious environmental targets, including carbon neutrality by 2025 and net zero emissions by 2030. This commitment is reflected in our efforts to transition our datacenter towards green computational capacity by benefitting from advanced software and digitalization techniques to significantly reduce emissions. Our initiatives also include facilitating access to compensation mechanisms and implementing carbon offsetting projects, such as direct investments in local reforestation efforts. Furthermore, we are committed to reducing our office footprint through digitalization, including paper-use reduction via e-invoicing solutions, and transitioning our fleet to full electric and hybrid vehicles. Our environmental focus extends to our customers, suppliers and communities. By benefitting from our software and digitalization capabilities, we aim to facilitate ----- their sustainable transition to more eco-friendly operations. Additionally, we offer waste-compliant solutions for companies to digitize business management, automate processes, and manage critical factors without crossplatform integration issues. In the social realm, we are deeply committed to diversity and inclusion as well as employee well-being and development. Our initiatives focus on promoting gender diversity and empowering young graduates. We have implemented a broad program for new ways of working, including working from home and “Light Fridays,” and offer a comprehensive welfare program for employees and their families, which includes online psychological counseling services and periodic training courses. Our diversity and inclusion efforts are supported by a KPI dashboard that tracks metrics such as new hires, re-hires, and promotions. Furthermore, we engage in early STEM education through school orientation activities and employer branding communication campaigns. We also support the development of our employees through comprehensive training and well-being programs, while adopting a sustainable governance and business model to ensure long-term success. In addition to our internal focus, our value proposition also includes solutions targeting the non-profit sector, such as member management, courses, summer camps, dues, and accounting. Our governance strategy is underpinned by a dedicated committee on ESG and risk management, non-financial reporting, and external certifications such as ESG ratings and B-Corp. We have established robust policies and compliance measures, including whistleblowing, anti-bribery, ethical codes, and data protection standards (ISDP 10003, ISO27001). Our dedicated cybersecurity team, led by our Head of Cybersecurity and Compliance, is critical to our commitment to ensure compliance with the highest standards of data protection and security. We believe our commitment to sustainability, social responsibility, and robust governance not only enhances our competitive position but also ensures we contribute positively to the environment and society.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: TeamSystem Group Organic Revenue Growth (YoY %)[1 ]
Subsubsection Title: Experienced management team with a proven track record in delivering growth and profitability
Subsubsection Text: We are managed by a strong executive team, which comprises individuals with many years of relevant experience and provides leadership across all functional areas of our business. Our management team includes members who benefit from experience in leading international groups, members who have been with us for more than ten years and who have developed a strong knowledge of the industry, and high-performing talents with experience in leading international consultancy firms. Our management team has demonstrated its ability to grow our business and improve operating performance, as evidenced by the increase in our revenues and Adjusted EBITDA over a long period, including in the face of global economic downturns and economic instability. Due to our effective retention and incentive mechanisms, we have maintained stability in our top management, ensuring continuity and consistency in our leadership. We believe the industry knowledge and leadership of our management team, combined with their long-term experience and strong execution capabilities, provide us with a significant competitive advantage. We also benefit from the strong expertise in the software industry and the long-term commitment of our principal shareholder, H&F. Since 2016, H&F has implemented successful value creation initiatives and demonstrated a strong partnership with our management team, driving our business internationally. We believe that our shareholders have high conviction in the business with outstanding organic growth opportunities and strong competitive positioning. We believe that our current management team and ownership structure will allow us to continue to attract and retain the industry’s top talent, further driving sustainable profitable growth

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: TeamSystem Group Organic Revenue Growth (YoY %)[1 ]
Subsubsection Text: _Source: IMF –World Economic Outlook Database; Management analysis._ (1) The organic growth is based on managerial accounts; statutory organic growth for the year ended December 31, 2021, 2022 and 2023 was 6.7%, 10.5% and 13.7%, respectively. Our resilience is evidenced by a consistent pattern of organic revenue growth since 2009, even during periods of economic turbulence. We believe such sustained growth is attributable to several key factors: (i) the recurring nature of our contracts; (ii) our customers’ loyalty, as demonstrated by our high NPS and low churn rates; (iii) the mission-critical nature of our software, our broad, rich and fully integrated product suite, which makes customers, particularly SMEs and professional clients, reluctant to switch to alternative suppliers due to the time-consuming migration process, allowing us to maintain sales even during economic downturns; and (iv) our strong brand recognition. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, we generated 83.5% of our total revenue from recurring sources (compared to 81.6% in 2021), which we believe provides significant visibility of future earnings. In particular, in the three-month period ended March 31, 2024 our recurring revenue accounted for 86.5% of our total revenue underscoring our stability and predictability from the first months of each calendar year. The growth in the contribution of revenues with a recurring nature to our total revenue has been driven in part by the increased weight and importance of our cloud solutions in our product portfolio, with the contribution of cloud software solutions revenue to our total revenue increasing from 39.8% in 2021 to 48.5% for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024. In addition, our profitability and cash flow generation have also shown significant improvement. Our Adjusted EBITDA grew from €170.1 million (€199.7 million on a pro forma basis to give effect the 2021 Acquisition as if it had occurred on January 1, 2021) in 2021 to €227.3 million in 2022, €313.8 million in 2023, and €334.9 million for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, respectively. As a result, our Adjusted EBITDA margin grew from ----- 41.4% in 2021 (40.8% on a pro forma basis to give effect the 2021 Acquisition as if it had occurred on January 1, 2021) to 43.0% for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024. We believe there is a correlation between margins and shares in our reference sectors, therefore, we see strong upside potential as we consolidate our multi-platform offerings. Furthermore, our invoicing strategy enhances our financial stability by invoicing our customers in advance at the beginning of each calendar year during our annual budgeting process. Additionally, most of our contracts are typically renewed unless customers provide a written termination notice prior to expiration. This approach gives us strong visibility over our cash flows and capital requirements, allowing us to carefully plan our capital needs and ensuring consistent and regular revenue streams. We believe that our billing pattern contributes to the overall visibility of our cash flows and ensures substantial liquidity. With over 70% of invoices issued between fourth quarter of each calendar year and the first quarter of the subsequent calendar year, we secure significant cash-in contributions in the first half of the year, effectively covering our cash needs, with about 30% of invoices issued during the second and third quarter of the year, primarily for prepaid cloud products for micro and small businesses. Approximately 35% of our invoices are issued in January and 50% by March, providing us with the liquidity needed for the rest of the year. Year-end invoicing for our In Cloud products, sold on annual subscription models, further enhances cash flow predictability. We believe that this invoicing strategy enables us to effectively predict and monitor our revenue and cash flow levels, ensuring strong liquidity and contributing to our financial stability and operational efficiency. As a result, we maintain a robust Operating Free Cash Flow, which further supports our financial health and strategic initiatives. The following chart shows the evolution of our Operating Free Cash Flow for each calendar month of the year ended December 31, 2023. _Source: Management analysis._ (1) “OCF” means operating free cash flow. (2) “OCF YtD” refers to the aggregate operating free cash flow from January 1, 2023 to the applicable month of the year ended December 31, 2023.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our strategy
Subsubsection Title: Continue growing our customer base by benefitting from untapped opportunities in the international segments
Subsubsection Text: We believe that we are best positioned to leverage our broad product platform and capitalize on favorable regulatory tailwinds to continue growing our customer base in the international segments. We intend to continue consolidating our presence in Spain and Turkey while exploring further expansion opportunities, including other European countries. The Spanish ERP sector presents significant growth opportunities. Spain currently lags slightly behind the European average in terms of digitalization, with publicly available data indicating that only approximately onethird of enterprises have adopted cloud solutions. We aim to capitalize on this substantial growth potential by expanding our presence and establishing ourselves as the preferred provider for businesses transitioning to digital business management by, among others, offering comprehensive cloud solutions alongside user-friendly einvoicing systems. Similar to the Italian ERP sector, we believe that favorable regulatory trends in Spain, including mandatory e-invoicing, will facilitate further sector expansion. In particular, the mandatory e-invoicing regulations in Spain, expected to be implemented between 2025 and 2027, present a significant opportunity for growth and expansion. This regulatory change is anticipated to unlock substantial potential, benefitting from an estimated 3.4 million of addressable customers, of which 3.3 million micro businesses and 0.1 million SMEs as of December 31, 2023. The implementation will follow a specific timeline based on a turnover threshold of €8 million, requiring legal entities and sole traders above this threshold to issue and receive e-invoices. We believe this regulatory shift will facilitate the adoption of our comprehensive cloud solutions and user-friendly e-invoicing systems by offering tailored solutions for businesses transitioning to digital business management. ----- In Turkey, the mandatory adoption of e-invoicing, driven by inflation and efforts to address the shadow economy, presents another growth opportunity for us to cater to an estimated 3.8 million of addressable customers, of which 3.5 million micro businesses and 0.3 million SMEs as of December 31, 2023. The expansion of e-invoicing compliance, expected to be implemented between 2023 and 2027, will require e-invoicing for companies with a turnover of 3 million Turkish lira. Approximately 800,000 businesses are expected to fall within the regulation by 2025, with more than 1 million by 2027 due to inflation. This regulatory change is likely to drive micro businesses toward ERP adoption, improving our overall segment penetration.
