By offering compliant and efficient e-invoicing solutions, we aim to help Turkish businesses navigate the regulatory landscape and enhance their financial management, replicating our successful strategy from Italy.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our strategy
Subsubsection Title: Continue benefitting from our large customer base to facilitate growth of our innovative cross-segment product suite
Subsubsection Text: Benefitting from our large and diversified customer base, we aim to facilitate the growth of our innovative crosssegment product suite. By focusing on Digital Finance, HR, Extended CRM and Trust solutions, we benefit from significant cross-selling opportunities across both our Italian and international segments. We believe that integrating these advanced tools with our existing ERP and FMS software provides a seamless and efficient business management ecosystem. Our product offerings are highly customizable and have been developed both internally and through strategic acquisitions. We have integrated these offerings into our ERP and FMS product suite, tailoring them to serve our three target customer segments: micro businesses, mid-market businesses and professionals. By defining specific go-to-market strategies for each customer segment, we believe we have been able, and will continue, to grow efficiently and effectively. Our Digital Finance products offer value-added services that streamline financial operations and improve cash flow management. Our HR Solutions, fully integrated with our ERP and FMS software, ensure a seamless experience that enhances operational efficiency and data consistency. We believe that these solutions cater to the diverse needs of our customer base, driving further adoption and satisfaction. Extended CRM provides tools for relationship management, marketing automation, and e-commerce integration, helping businesses scale operations and enhance customer engagement. Trust Services enable secure, compliant digital operations through digital signatures, archiving, and SPID access. By integrating with our ERP and FMS software, these services ensure streamlined operations and data consistency, providing customers with the tools needed to operate securely and efficiently in a digital environment. We believe cross-selling these solutions to our Italian and international customer base will allow us to benefit from our competitive presence and customer relationships, enabling our customers to fully benefit from a fully integrated business management platform. This comprehensive range of interconnected solutions is expected to enhance customer satisfaction and retention, thereby maximizing customer lifetime value.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our strategy
Subsubsection Title: Capture upselling opportunities within our existing customer base, particularly among our micro business customers, by repositioning customers toward software packages with more advanced features
Subsubsection Text: Since 2014, we have consistently advanced our cloud-based solutions, benefitting from strong digitalization trends and capitalizing on new regulatory obligations, such as Italian e-invoicing regulations, requiring new or updated software. Our focus on the micro business customer segment has enabled us to secure a leading position in this segment by offering user-friendly e-invoicing solutions. These solutions are available in various packages with additional functionalities and price tiers tailored to the specific needs of clients, such as Fatture in Cloud “Standard,” Fatture in Cloud “Premium,” Fatture in Cloud “Premium Plus,” and Fatture in Cloud “Complete.” Moving forward, we plan to capitalize on upselling opportunities within our existing customer base, particularly among our micro business customers, by transitioning them to premium versions of our software with more advanced features, such as the “Premium,” “Premium Plus,” and “Complete” tiers of our Fatture in Cloud software. To support this upselling strategy, we plan to introduce integrated and comprehensive solutions that capitalize on our strong relationships with accountant customers to facilitate and promote migration from our TeamSystem Digital platform, which generates on average an ARPU ranging from €10 to €20 per year, to higher-ARPU generating solutions, such as Fatture in Cloud and Contabilità in Cloud solutions, which generate on average an ARPU ranging from €140 to €500 per year. Currently, we provide tailored packages of our cloud-based solutions, such as Digital Invoice and Fatture in Cloud, to our accountant customers, who resell these to their clients. In the future, we plan to continue offering tailored packages while also supporting our accountant customers in digitizing ----- their internal processes and relationships with end-customers through premium software. To support this reposition, we expect to further develop our Fatture in Cloud suite for micro business customers by progressively adding advanced functionalities and features to boost upselling activity, such as dashboards for integrated client management. These solutions will simplify and automate data exchange and basic tax and accounting activities through our cloud products and enable end-customers of accountants to focus on higher value-added services. We believe these initiatives will, in turn, help accountants build loyalty with their clients and strengthen their dependence on our platforms at higher subscription fees.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our strategy
Subsubsection Title: Benefitting from AI and data to enhance customer service, optimize business operations and deliver smarter, AI-driven products
Subsubsection Text: We have developed a comprehensive strategy to benefit from AI and data as pivotal drivers for our growth and differentiation. As of March 31, 2024, approximately 700 thousand of our customers used at least one of our products with an embedded AI feature. We plan to develop a multi-AI platform to govern services and create cross-synergies, offering AI-based products and services such as virtual assistants and self-service business intelligence tools. We also expect our AI platform to support new AI use cases, enabling us to redesign internal processes, reduce manual tasks as well as provide valuable insights to our customers. We also intend to collect, catalogue and measure data from our main products, ensuring all domains are integrated into a comprehensive data platform. By implementing robust data governance, we plan to enhance customer experience, product offerings and business operations. We also intend to support data monetization by selling aggregated and benchmarked data to customers and third parties. We intend to focus on developing AI and data-driven features across all key products, including customer assistant tools, machine learning accounting and business insights. Our initiatives are expected to improve data infrastructure and services, providing a new way to access and understand data. By coordinating cross-business unit projects and fostering an internal AI and data culture, we aim to be recognized as a key data player in the industry. Our strategy includes a people-driven approach to AI, ensuring that our employees are equipped with the necessary skills and knowledge to benefit from data as an asset. We intend to continue building awareness and promoting a culture of AI and data both internally and externally, positioning ourselves as leaders in the field. By integrating AI and data into our operations, we expect to improve how we serve our customers and run our business. This will enable us to offer smarter, AI-based and data-driven products that meet the evolving needs of our customers. Our commitment to adopting AI and data is expected to drive innovation, efficiency and growth, ensuring we remain at the forefront of our industry.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our strategy
Subsubsection Text: Since 2021, we have focused on the digitalization of our customer base, rationalizing our sales model and strengthening customer retention and satisfaction. Additionally, we have focused on expanding our horizontal solutions to drive upselling and cross-selling opportunities. This strategic emphasis has enabled us to better meet diverse customer needs and enhance our value proposition. Our internationalization efforts have also been pivotal, expanding our presence beyond Italy and capturing new opportunities, which now account for a growing share of our revenue. To support this expansion and our broader growth objectives, we have revised our organizational structure, aligning it more closely with our strategic priorities and improving operational efficiency. As a result of these strategic focuses, we have achieved remarkable growth and transformation, doubling in scale and enhancing our business diversification and quality, with a significant acceleration in value creation. _Business scale: Since 2020, we have made significant progress across multiple dimensions of our business. Our_ total revenue has increased at a CAGR of 20.2% from €422.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2020, to €778.7 million for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, with average organic growth over the same period ----- reaching 10%. As part of this overall growth, our international operations have also shown significant expansion. Our adjusted EBITDA has also seen substantial growth, from €181.2 million to €313.8 million over the same period. Additionally, our customer base expanded from 1.6 million as of the year ended December 31, 2021 to 2.1 million as of the year ended December 31, 2023, driven by new client acquisitions, particularly among micro and small businesses adopting mandatory e-invoicing, and international growth in Spain and Turkey, which accounted for approximately 300 thousand customers as of December 31, 2023. _Business Mix and Geographic Diversification: We have accelerated our business diversification both_ geographically and in terms of our business mix. In 2020, we only generated revenues in Italy, whereas for the three months ended March 31, 2024, our international expansions grew at a faster pace than our domestic revenue and accounted for approximately 10% of our total revenue for such period. Additionally, our revenue mix has also evolved significantly since 2020, with the micro and small customer segment representing approximately 27.0% of our total revenues for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024 in acceleration representing 31% of our total revenues for the three-month period ended December 31, 2024, increasing from 18% for the year ended December 31, 2020. We have also increased our focus on cross-selling platforms such as HR, Extended CRM and Trust Services, bolstered by strategic acquisitions which have generated 7% of our total revenues for twelve months ended March 31, 2024. _Business Quality: Our business quality has significantly improved, with recurring revenues increasing from 79.7%_ for the year ended December 31, 2020 to 83.5% for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, and cloud revenues rising from 38% of our total revenue for the year ended December 31, 2020 to 49.9% of our total revenue for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024. Since 2021, our customer retention rates and NPS have both improved, with churn levels decreasing across segments despite price increases, and NPS increasing from 36 as of December 31, 2020 to 55 as of December 31, 2023. As a result of the above, the growth in our organic ARR (representing the annual subscription fees in respect of our subscription agreements relating to certain key products that were in place as of a certain date, net of all subscription fees associated with churning customers who delivered termination notices on or prior to such date) amounted to approximately 10% in 2020, 12% in 2021, 12% in 2022 and 14% in 2023 (with a Net Retention Rate of 105.5%, 104.5%, 107.9% and 106.3% for the same periods). We now plan to continue further consolidating these trends to achieve long-term sustainable growth and strengthen our leadership in our core reference segments by: (i) selectively expanding our customer base; (ii) growing topline revenue by benefitting from upselling and cross-selling opportunities within our large and diversified customer base; and (iii) further improving our sales model while enhancing customer satisfaction and retention rates. Additionally, we aim to fully integrate data analysis and AI into our operations and product suites, enhance our offerings with the launch of SaaS-only products developed under the “One Platform” concept, and continue our commitment to sustainability. We intend to achieve these goals by pursuing the following strategies:

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: History
Subsubsection Text: Our business dates back to 1979, when we were established as a distributor in Italy for Triumph Adler, a German hardware and software producer. In the early 1980s, we pivoted to developing our own software products. We launched GeCom Multi, GeCom Redditi, and GeCom Paghe, becoming a leading software provider for tax advisors, accountants, and labor advisors by the 1990s.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: History
Subsubsection Text: In 2000, Palamon Capital Partners acquired us to consolidate the fragmented Italian ERP market. We launched Gamma Enterprise, an ERP system for SMEs, in 2001, followed by Gamma Sprint and Gamma Plus in 2002, expanding our reach into SME and micro business segments. The acquisition of Euroconference further strengthened our presence in professional training for accountants, lawyers, and tax advisors. -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: History
Subsubsection Text: In 2005, we were acquired by Bain Capital, guiding us into the legal software market with Lexteam. During this period, we expanded our SME customer base and direct sales channels, leading to a dedicated business unit for enterprise customers.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: History
Subsubsection Text: In 2010, we embarked on a transformative period marked by strategic acquisitions, innovative product launches, and key partnerships. That year, Hg acquired control of the Group. In 2011, we launched TeamSystem Service for payroll outsourcing and TeamSystem Communication for integrated telephone solutions. From 2010 to 2012, we acquired several software companies. In 2015, we introduced Lynfa (now TeamSystem Studio) and Alyante (now TeamSystem Enterprise) on the Polyedro platform. We launched TeamSystem Store in 2016 and shifted our M&A strategy in 2017, partnering with Vodafone and Telecom Italia. The Polyedro platform evolved into Agyo (now TeamSystem Digital). In 2018, we updated products for GDPR compliance and enhanced our e-invoicing solutions. In 2019, we redesigned TeamSystem Enterprise. In 2021, we launched TS Pay, our digital payment platform. In 2022, we developed TeamSystem Signature and TeamSystem SPID for digital authentication.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: History
Subsubsection Title: International Expansion and Cross-Selling Initiatives (2016 – today)
Subsubsection Text: In March 2016, Hellman & Friedman acquired control of the Group from Hg. Following our organic growth and the extension of our operations, including a strategic phase of bolt-on acquisitions to further consolidate our position, we embarked on an internationalization path supported by our cross-selling strategy. Over the last ten years, we have carried out a number of acquisitions. Between 2013 and 2016, we acquired: (i) ACG and TSS (formerly 24OreSoftware), to strengthen and consolidate our position in the Italian software segment for SMEs and professionals; (ii) Fatture in Cloud, to enter the Italian software segment for micro and small businesses with an innovative cloud solution for electronic invoicing; and (iii) AliasLab and its subsidiaries to expand our cloud offer in the electronic signature and authentication services businesses. In 2017, we entered the micro and small business B2C-oriented segment by acquiring a controlling interest in Cassanova, which has developed Cassa in Cloud, an innovative cloud solution that satisfies the regulatory requirement for retail micro and small businesses, such as restaurants and shops, to electronically share receipts (“corrispettivi telematici”) with the Italian Tax Authority on a daily basis. Moreover, in 2019, we acquired (i) a controlling interest in TechMass, an innovative start-up focused on so called “Industry 4.0” solutions that launched a cloud-native product for the monitoring and optimization of production processes; (ii) Iperelle, a provider of CAD solutions, that allowed us to complement our CAD software offering, addressing large manufacturing companies not covered with our Nuovamacut solutions; and (iii) a controlling interest in SkyLab, a provider of cloud solutions. Through the acquisition of SkyLab, we developed a new “all-in-one” solution for human resources (“HR”), which we integrated with our HR payroll and HR administration solutions, allowing our customers to manage employees’ recruiting, careers, performance management, careers, development plans, benefits, training and health and safety. In 2020, we acquired a controlling interest in MBM Italia, a software house to complement our “Industry 4.0” products offer with solutions for logistics and planning and management of production processes, warehouse management and delivery control solutions and complete ERP specific for fashion, apparel and footwear industry. That year, with the aim of expanding and internationalizing our business, we acquired Software del Sol, a Spanish company based in Jaén, Andalusia. In 2021, we acquired Logical Soft, a software house specializing in the production of technical software for construction and engineering and Progetto Studio, a company that, among others things, resells TeamSystem® products and solutions. In addition, with the aim of expanding and internationalizing our operations and projects, we acquired a controlling interest in Billin, a Spanish start-up that developed cloud software product for the Spanish segment. In 2022, we acquired a controlling stake in Storeden, a developer and distributor of e-commerce software. Through this acquisition, we developed TeamSystem Commerce, a digital platform designed to facilitate online buying and selling activities for businesses, offering features such as product catalog management, order processing, payment processing and customer relationship management. In addition, in 2022, to consolidate our expansion into the Spanish segment, we acquired a controlling interest in Software del Sol, a Spanish company leader in the SME management solutions segment in Spain. ----- In 2023, we further expanded our portfolio and market reach with key acquisitions. In particular, we acquired a controlling interest in (i) MailUp, a comprehensive suite of technology solutions for marketers, including an easyto-use platform for unlimited email and SMS marketing and a customer data platform that integrates data to create targeted, automated campaigns for enhanced customer engagement and loyalty, which enabled us to enter the marketing automation sector and enhancing our customer’s revenue through personalized and automated marketing materials and (ii) GreeNext, a company operating in the development of software for waste management, which we expect to benefit from to enhance our cross-selling strategy to our larger customers. Furthermore, to strengthen our foothold in the Spanish segment and to enter into the Turkish segment, we acquired Acumbamail, Aplifisa and the Mikro group. Acumbamail is a versatile marketing platform equipped with features such as customizable templates, automated workflows and in-depth analytics, designed to help businesses effectively connect with their audience. Aplifisa is a company that develops and markets software solutions for accountants and tax advisors in the Spanish segment. The Mikro group is a leading provider of software solutions for tax advisors, micro businesses and the ERP sector in Turkey, along with various complementary products. At the beginning of 2024, our new minority shareholders, Luxinva, CapitalG and Silver Lake joined our existing shareholders to participate in the continuous growth of our business. For more information regarding our shareholders, see “Principal shareholders.”

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: History
Subsubsection Text: Since our foundation in 1979, we have undergone a remarkable transformation, evolving through distinct phases that have shaped our identity and competitive position. From our entrepreneurial beginnings as a software distributor, we have navigated periods of strategic leadership shifts, market consolidation and international expansion.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our Business Units
Subsubsection Text: Our Enterprise Solutions business unit provides products and services for mid-market customers, which primarily comprise ERP and FMS software that caters to the needs of various business departments of companies, including administration, finance, human resources, sales, supply chain management and production, along with supplementary products and specialized vertical solutions. Key products offered within our Enterprise Solutions business unit are TeamSystem Enterprise, TeamSystem Enterprise Cloud, TeamSystem Enterprise Industry 4.0 and TeamSystem Enterprise Power-I. Our ERP software is characterized by modularity and customization capabilities, which enable efficient management of electronic invoicing, project management, warehouse logistics, expense management and human resources, allowing SMEs to streamline their processes effectively. Our ERP solutions are available in both cloud and on-premise configurations. The cloud-based version offers scalability, ease of use and mobile accessibility, making it an ideal choice for businesses seeking flexibility and reduced IT overhead. Conversely, the on-premise option ensures greater control over customization addressing the specific needs of customers. In addition to core ERP software, our Enterprise Solutions business unit features robust business intelligence and analytics tools, including CRM, Sales App and Document Management Systems. These tools support interactive analysis, dynamic presentations and strategic decision-making through real-time data insights. Designed for ease of use, they integrate data from multiple sources to provide comprehensive business insights. Furthermore, our recent acquisitions have allowed us to extend into specific segments, tailoring our services to meet the unique demands of specific industries such as wine, retail, fashion and waste management, thereby enhancing our industry-specific expertise and product suite. Support and customization offerings are integral to our Enterprise Solutions business unit. We offer extensive support services, including expert assistance, a dedicated support portal and continuous software updates. This comprehensive support ensures that businesses can customize the ERP system and other software to meet their specific needs while maintaining high performance and minimizing IT maintenance.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our Business Units
Subsubsection Text: Our Professional Solutions business unit mainly provides products and services for professionals and labor consultants. While the primary focus of our Professional Solutions business unit is on professionals and labor ----- consultants, our customer base extends to micro and small businesses and SMEs through the services provided by our accountant customers, enabling us to target a broader market indirectly. Our Professional Solutions business unit delivers comprehensive software designed to streamline and enhance the workflow and management processes of professional firms. Our key products include TeamSystem Studio Cloud, TeamSystem Legal TeamSystem Paghe and TeamSystem Via Libera Cloud and provide for a comprehensive set of tools for managing accounting, payroll, billing and compliance tasks, aimed at improving efficiency and productivity in these professional environments. For accounting and payroll management, our Professional Solutions business unit provides comprehensive software that facilitates the handling of accounting tasks, payroll calculations and compliance with regulatory requirements. These tools are essential for ensuring accurate financial management and streamlining payroll processes. Our Professional Solutions business unit also offers tax and compliance services, helping professionals stay updated with the latest tax regulations and ensuring compliance with tax requirements and accurate tax preparation and filing. Billing and invoicing solutions are another key component of the Professional Solutions business unit, which help professionals manage client billing, track payments and handle accounts efficiently, thus maintaining organized financial records. For legal professionals and consultants, the Professional Solutions business unit provides client and case management solutions. These tools assist in managing client information, case files and documentation, streamlining case management processes and improving service delivery. Additionally, the Professional Solutions business unit ensures end-to-end support for customers, incorporating elements such as product marketing, sales, customer service and delivery to meet the specific needs of professional service providers. This focus allows us to maintain a customer-centric approach, providing integrated and innovative solutions that help professionals manage their operations more effectively.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our Business Units
Subsubsection Text: Our Micro Solutions business unit includes products and flexible solutions designed to address the needs of micro and small businesses and small business customers, most of which may be purchased through our digital sales channels. Our Micro Solutions business unit also offers services to enable the digitalization of micro and small businesses and small business customers and other ancillary cloud technology products. The software offered features a customizable interface, process automation and modularity, allowing micro and small businesses to add functionalities as needed. The software also includes advanced analytics and reporting tools, easy integration with other systems and secure mobile and cloud access, ensuring data protection and regulatory compliance. Our main product offering within our Micro Solutions consists of cloud-based solutions, including Fatture in Cloud.it, Contabilità in Cloud, Hotel in Cloud and Cassa in Cloud. To cater to specific industry needs, our Micro Solutions business unit offers a suite of market-specific cloud products. These consist of carefully developed solutions designed for three main industry verticals: wellness, hotels, restaurant and cafes (“HORECA”), associations/nonprofit organization and communication solutions (“Plus”). For example, our hospitality and retail solutions are tailored to assist our HORECA customers in managing reservations, sales and customer relationships more effectively, thereby streamlining their operations and enhancing their and their end-customers’ experience. The chart below describes our main product offering for our wellness, HORECA, associations/non-profit organization and Plus segments: _Source: Company information._ -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our Business Units
Subsubsection Text: Our Digital Finance Solutions business unit specializes in providing services to streamline financial operations for a variety of enterprises, including, among others, financial institutions, large companies, SMEs and professionals. Through this business unit, we offer a range of digital financial value-added services that support financial management, including rating services, credit management and digital payment solutions and aims at building a customer-centric ecosystem of support services catering to our broad and diversified customer base. Services offered through our Digital Finance Solutions business unit enhance liquidity management and enable seamless financial transaction processing, facilitating efficient and secure digital payment experiences for our customers through platforms such as invoice trading and supply chain finance. By integrating advanced technologies such as artificial intelligence and big data, the unit’s offerings improve accuracy and efficiency in financial processes. Through this business unit, we also prioritize security and regulatory compliance, collaborating with strategic partners, such as PayPal, to provide reliable and secure fintech solutions through certified entities like TeamSystem Capital at Work, Modefinance and TeamSystem Payments.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our Business Units
Subsubsection Text: Our Market Specific Solutions business unit includes products and services which are designed to address the needs of customers in specific industries, such as, among others, mechanical and manufacturing, construction, CAF/public sectors and legal. For the public sector and professional intermediaries like CAFs (Tax Assistance Centers), our Market Specific Solutions business unit offers comprehensive management systems that streamline workflows and ensure regulatory compliance. In the construction industry, we provide solutions for project management, procurement and site management, enhancing efficiency and coordination across projects. In the legal sector, the business unit delivers cloud-based management software that supports law firms and corporate legal departments with case management, billing and document storage. Our Market Specific Solutions customers are very heterogeneous, requiring a dedicated analysis of their needs and a focused approach to providing tailored software solutions and services.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our Business Units
Subsubsection Text: Our Cross Segment Product Solutions business unit offers both HR and Trust solutions to meet specialized requirements of our diverse customer base. Our Trust solutions distinguish themselves for their adaptability, strong security protocols and seamless integration with our ERP systems. Our HR solutions include TS HR, Dipendenti in Cloud, BPaaS and Welfare, which are designed to streamline administrative and managerial tasks, facilitating payroll processing, workforce monitoring, recruitment and welfare management. Cloud-based software in our Cross Segment Product Solutions business unit offers solutions tailored to manage the full spectrum of human resources functions for companies of various sizes. The platform’s modular design allows for extensive customization, accommodating the specific requirements of both small businesses and larger corporations. Through this business unit, we provide an integrated solution for the entire HR lifecycle, including recruitment, onboarding, employee management, payroll, performance evaluations and professional development. Products like TeamSystem HR offer structured and sophisticated software that meets the complex needs of our larger clients. In contrast, other solutions, such as Dipendenti in Cloud, deliver comprehensive and standardized services suitable for all-sized business and professionals. Trust services play a pivotal role in the digital transition of our varied customer base. It includes tools for digital identity management, such as e-signature services and SPID (Public Digital Identity System) and secured digital storage of documents, which all play a fundamental role in the digital transformation of our customer base. In addition, these services facilitate our customers’ compliance with evolving regulatory standards and ensure secure and efficient online transactions and simplify customer onboarding processes. Centralized document storage, realtime analytics and mobile accessibility are among the core features that facilitate a more streamlined and effective HR management process, which we also offer through our Cross-Segment Product business unit.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our Business Units
Subsubsection Text: Our business is organized into six business units: (a) Enterprise Solutions, (b) Professional Solutions, (c) Micro Solutions, (d) Digital Finance, (e) Market Specific Solutions and (f) Cross Segment Product Solutions. While our Enterprise Solutions, Professional Solutions and Micro Solutions specialize in specific customers’ clusters, our other business units offer comprehensive solutions across all of our customer segments. The following charts set forth our total revenue breakdown by business unit for the twelve months ended March 31, 2024. We believe that the combination of our business units have enabled us to build a significant competitive advantage within the Italian ERP market: Our Enterprise Solutions business unit enables us to simplify enterprise management processes and document flows; our Professional Solutions business unit allows us to cover all professional service needs of accountants and labor consultants through a single platform; our Market Specific Solutions business unit allows us to provide industry-specific products; our Micro Solutions business unit allows us to market, both in Italy and abroad, our cloud-based products to micro and small businesses customers and other ancillary cloud technology products offered also to other customer segments, such as CRM, E-commerce and Marketing Automation; our Digital Finance business unit allows us to merge the financial value chain with supply chain solutions; and our Cross Segment Product Solutions business unit allows us to offer a wide array of solutions across our entire customers segments, featuring HR Solutions to streamline HR management processes and Trust Solutions that integrate digital signature and authentication services, thereby enriching our software’s value proposition. The following chart illustrates our business units and the main products we offer through each of them to our various customer segments. ----- _Source: Management analysis._

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Customers
Subsubsection Text: We consider micro businesses to be primarily composed of small enterprises with less than ten employees, small partnerships and individuals with a VAT registration number (partite IVA) that engage in small business activities. We consider small businesses to comprise enterprises that employ between 10 and 49 individuals. Micro and small businesses generally have different needs as compared to professionals and mid-market businesses and we offer a number of specialized products, primarily cloud products relating to our Micro Solutions business unit, designed to cater to the unique needs of this customer base. We anticipate further significant potential upside in the sale of our cloud-based products to micro and small business customers, due to the large size of the Italian micro and small business software segment and its comparatively low level of penetration. Because our micro and small business customers require products tailored to different and simpler needs as compared to our professionals and mid-market enterprise products, we believe that the increased adoption and sales of our In Cloud product line will pose a limited risk of cannibalization of sales of our software products offered to our professionals and mid-market customers. Our solutions targeted at micro and small businesses (such as Fatture in Cloud and Danea EasyFatt) are marketed by all of our business units. Customers in the micro and small businesses segment are contacted indirectly via the Accountants Sales Channel and the Online Sales Channel, which are more aligned with the purchasing behaviors and service expectations of these customers. Revenues from this customer segment was generated through our accountants customers, which encourage their clients to adopt out solutions for streamlined accounting management. Accountants are generally incentivized to introduce new customers for multiple reasons, including, amongst others, an efficient integration of client data through our software solutions boosting business productivity and additional revenue streams from our referral awards (e.g., fee and credits). As a result, each new accountant we acquire often brings along their client base, thereby expanding our reach and impact within the micro and small businesses customer segment as well as the mid-sized businesses customer segment.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Customers
Subsubsection Text: Our professional customer base primarily consists of accountants, labor advisors, fiscal consultants and law firms. In Italy, professionals’ need for our software solutions and related updates is primarily driven by the complex and frequently evolving Italian accounting, tax and legal regulatory landscape, as well as the need to be equipped with software solutions to perform accounting, fiscal and payroll services for their customers. Our solutions targeted at professionals (such as Studio Cloud) are promoted by our Professional Solutions, Digital Finance and Market Specific Solutions business units, primarily through our Fields Sales Force, which still represents our main sales channel for these customers. Besides being valuable customers, accountants also play a pivotal role in connecting us with new micro and small business customers. They are often motivated to introduce our solutions to their ----- clients, capitalizing on their trusted status and close client relationships and are able to demonstrate the suitability of our products and services for their clients’ needs, including enhanced productivity. See “—Micro and Small _Businesses” and “—Our Sales Channels—Accountants Sales Channel.”_

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Customers
Subsubsection Text: We generally consider mid-market enterprises those that employ between 50 and 499 individuals, although this segment encompasses also larger companies. These companies often face unique challenges and require tailored solutions to support their growth and operational efficiency. To meet these needs, we offer a wide range of software products designed to serve the needs of our diverse mid-market customer base, with the main products lines being Enterprise Cloud and certain segment specific products. Our software solutions are designed to address the comprehensive needs of an average mid-size company’s organizational structure. Our offering includes traditional ERP systems that support finance and accounting departments, enhanced by marketing and sales tools such as CRM and Sales App. For operational personnel, from production and manufacturing to construction, we offer specific solutions that streamline their workflows. Additionally, we provide solutions for product engineering and development teams, including advanced CAD/CAM software, dedicated to specific clusters of customers. These products are marketed by our Enterprise Solutions, Digital Finance, Market Specific Solutions and Cross Segment Product Solutions business units primarily through our Fields Sales Force, which still represents the main sales channel and ensure we cover the full spectrum of our mid-market customers’ organizational need.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Customers
Subsubsection Text: Our three key end-customer groups are micro and small businesses, mid-market businesses and professionals. Internationally, our micro and small business, mid-market business and professional customer groups have seen growth, reflecting our increasing global reach and penetration. ----- As set out in the chart below, our end-customer base increased from approximately 1.5 million as of December 31, 2021 to approximately 2.2 million as of December 31, 2023. Of this total figure, approximately 1,845,000 are micro and small businesses, approximately 180,000 are mid-market businesses and approximately 80,000 are professionals. Our large and diverse customer base is highly fragmented and diversified in terms of number of customers, industries and geography. As of March 31, 2024, we had approximately 271 thousand customers outside of Italy. For example, our largest 10, 50 and 200 customers accounted for 5.0%, 10.4% and 15.3% of our total revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. Generally, there is no particular industry on which we rely for our customer base, which we believe helps sustain our business through the various economic cycles. In addition, we have historically experienced high Customer Retention Rates. See “—Our strengths— Large, highly diversified and _fragmented customer base characterized by high retention rates.”_ We serve our customers through the broad offering of our business units, which allow us to deliver a comprehensive suite of products and services that assist our customers with their day-to-day business operations and ease their shift to digital management systems and cloud solutions. Their collaboration is aimed at, amongst others, promoting cross-selling opportunities and creating a product ecosystem that addresses our customers’ specific requirements and needs. We have honed a diverse mix of sales channels to effectively broaden our reach and cater to the varied preferences of our customer base in terms of communication, sales and support. For instance, our micro and small business customers are less frequently engaged through our Field Sales Channels. Instead, we predominantly reach these customers indirectly via our network of accountant customers and through our online channels, which are more aligned with the purchasing behaviors and service expectations of these customers.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our Product Offering
Subsubsection Text: Our product offering is carefully divided to cater to the diverse requirements of our customer base, providing solutions that are customized for businesses of different size and needs. These offering includes, amongst others, specialized state-of-the-art features that increase operational efficiency and advanced analytics, bolstered by AI tools and capabilities. We have developed and continuously improve, an integrated cloud and other applications suite that enables customer collaboration and allows us to implement cross-selling initiatives of certain of our solutions. The chart below shows our product offering across our key customer segments. As shown in the table below, certain of our products are dedicated to specific clusters of customers, while others are typically for our entire customer’s platform. _Source: Management analysis._ -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: In Cloud
Subsubsection Text: We offer a range of cloud products as part of our ERP and FMS platforms and market specific solutions that enable micro and small businesses to digitalize their core or basic processes to quote, bill, manage customer relationships and streamline business monitoring. These offerings have an intuitive and user-friendly interface, which is continuously enhanced through regular updates, ensuring ease of use. In Cloud is designed as a comprehensive solution, providing a single point of contact tailored specifically for micro and small businesses, addressing their distinct operational needs. The software features deep integration with accountant systems, facilitating seamless collaboration between businesses and their accountants and offering features like multi-user access and deadline tracking, which are essential for maintaining clear and timely communication. Furthermore, it includes an open API, allowing accessibility to third parties for the development of new front-end applications. Currently, this API supports 25 integrations, serving over 3,000 users, thereby enhancing the software’s functionality and extending its utility. The objective of In Cloud is meeting key customer needs through comprehensive functional coverage. This includes accounting features such as purchase and cashflow tracking, analysis and reporting tools that assist with VAT, profit and turnover estimations, as well as inventory management and other features that enable the creation of digital invoices by mobile app or e-mail. Set forth below is a description our key In Cloud products offered to our micro and small business customers: - _Fatture in Cloud. Fatture in Cloud is our simple invoicing and accounting platform specifically designed for micro and small businesses as well as professionals, which uses a cloud-based platform that may be accessed by any device that is connected to the internet (e.g., computer, smartphone, tablet, etc.) through an internet browser or a specific application compatible with both iOS and Android. Fatture in Cloud allows customers to, among other things, electronically produce and send any type of invoice to any type of customer, including public administration organizations, monitor and manage Italian tax payment obligations (so-called “F24” forms), track expenses and automatically generate accounting records of invoices without any manual data entry. Additionally, the platform integrates a digital collection and payment services functions, enabling receipt of payments, including by credit or debit card payments, through its integration with TS Pay. In addition, we expect to integrate our Danea software into Fatture in Cloud. Danea, and, specifically, Danea Easyfatt, offers a solution tailored for small to medium-sized enterprises, artisans, professionals and retailers to enhance their business management capabilities. This software encompasses various critical functions that streamline operational workflows, ensuring efficiency and compliance with regulatory standards. Danea Easyfatt is equipped with comprehensive invoicing capabilities, facilitating the creation, issuance and digital signing of electronic invoices, in alignment with Italian fiscal regulations. This includes support for business-to-business, business-toconsumer and public administration invoicing, ensuring broad applicability across different transaction types. The software’s inventory management module provides thorough oversight of inventory operations, allowing for management of stock levels, tracking of product movements across multiple warehouses and generation of detailed inventory reports. In addition to inventory management, Danea Easyfatt integrates with e-commerce software, including TeamSystem Commerce, facilitating synchronization between online store operations and the management software. Furthermore, Danea Easyfatt supports sales and purchase analysis, enabling insights into business performance. The software also includes functionalities for barcode and label printing, document management and scheduling of business appointments. - _Contabilità in Cloud. An accounting platform primarily designed for small enterprises, including groups with non-Italian subsidiaries. Contabilità in Cloud uses a cloud-based platform and may be accessed through any device that is connected to the internet. It allows data to flow seamlessly among the various users in the organization as well as any external accounting consultants. Contabilità in Cloud also allows customer to, among other things, manage all accounting processes, electronically produce and send any type of invoice to any type of customer, including public administration organizations, monitor and manage F24 forms, monitor bank account transfers, monitor the overall business performance, manage logistics and inventory, etc. Recognizing the diverse needs of different business segments, our In Cloud software provides dedicated solutions tailored to specific industries such as wellness, hotels and NGOs. Set forth below is a description our key segmentspecific In Cloud solutions: ----- - _Cassa in Cloud. Cassa in Cloud is our easy-to-use business management software (and accompanying hardware) primarily designed for shops and restaurants. Cassa in Cloud uses a cloud-based platform and may be accessed by an unlimited number of users through any device that is connected to the internet. Cassa in Cloud allows our customer to, among other things, have real time access to their business performance (e.g., sales report, stock availability, out-of-stock monitoring, shops assistants performance, etc.), do internal accounting, electronically produce and send any type of invoice to any type of customers, receive invoices from suppliers, electronically share receipts (“corrispettivi telematici”) with the Italian Tax Authority on a daily basis. Cassa in Cloud has differentiated features and functionalities (i) for restaurants, such as, tables and orders collection and management through tablets, digital menu, kitchen monitoring and (ii) for retail shops, such as management of size and colors of the items sold in the shop, bar code scan and management, stock management and simple e-commerce set-up. - _Wellness in Cloud. We offer a variety of products, including both on premise and SaaS versions, for the wellness industry, including facilities such as gyms, pools and leisure centers. These products enable customers to efficiently run their businesses by, for example, maintaining members’ details, monitoring on-site accesses, planning work-outs, scheduling classes and assigning members to them, managing memberships, processing billing and payments and performing other administrative tasks. Sales of our wellness solutions are generally made under a subscription model, with automatic renewal every year, thus contributing to our recurring revenues streams. - _Hotel in Cloud. Hotel in Cloud includes our range of solutions for hotels, bed and breakfasts (“B&Bs”) and tourism operators. These products enable customers to manage all typical processes of an hospitality player (independent hotels, B&Bs and hotel chains) including, for example, bookings and room reservations, check-in/check-out processes, regulatory requirements (e.g., the obligation to store and transmit data related to transactions to the Italian tax authority on a daily basis), restaurant services, cleaning services, staff management, cost control and other accounting functionalities.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Studio Cloud
Subsubsection Text: Studio Cloud is a comprehensive and scalable platform designed to meet the diverse needs of professionals, such as accountants, law firms and CAFs. For accountants, the solution offers a fully integrated solution that consolidates all necessary functionalities into a single product suite, eliminating the need for accountants to purchase multiple applications from different providers. The platform is periodically updated to ensure compliance with the latest regulatory standards, aligning accountants’ practice with the latest legal requirements. Studio Cloud’s key functional coverage includes financial statement management and tracking, payroll management and tax management, all of which are essential for efficient accounting operations. One of the core features of Studio Cloud is its client integration capability, which enables accountants to manage and track their clients’ financial activities by connecting with client dashboards. Additionally, the system includes automatic Italian tax processing and income declaration functionalities, which streamline the tax management process for accountants. Studio Cloud also emphasizes collaboration and consulting services through its Digital Box feature, which facilitates real-time data and information exchange. The platform’s scalability is a significant advantage, as it caters to professional firms of all sizes with its range of basic to advanced toolkits and wider studio management applications. Studio Cloud is fully digital, boasting a simple user experience across devices, including a comprehensive mobile offering, ensuring accountants can work efficiently from anywhere. Moreover, Studio Cloud provides training modules, such as those offered by Euroconference, to keep customers informed about regulatory changes and relevant deadlines. This educational component ensures that accountants remain knowledgeable and up-to-date with industry developments.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Enterprise Cloud
Subsubsection Text: Enterprise Cloud is a comprehensive ERP solution designed to support mid-sized companies through their digital transformation journey. This platform is tailored to enhance the efficiency and competitiveness of businesses by addressing their key needs with a full suite of customizable and scalable solutions. At the center of Enterprise Cloud’s offering is a digital accounting solution that enables reporting and simulation capabilities. This fully digital, multi-device system boasts a seamless user experience, allowing for efficient budgeting and tracking of sales developments in alignment with commercial requirements. Specifically conceived for Italian businesses, Enterprise Cloud ensures full compliance with Italian regulatory frameworks, making it a reliable choice for local enterprises. The product’s FMS platform includes a comprehensive cash management module that provides a holistic view of cash positions, while the inventory management system supports tracking, valorization using Last ----- In-First-Out, First-In-First-Out, or average methods and replenishment. The FMS platform also includes a procurement modules that aims to manage and streamline purchasing processes. Enterprise Cloud also offers enterprise specific modules, such as custom ERP solutions for manufacturing and production clients. The platform also includes administration and project management tools designed to enhance information storage and productivity. Additionally, the client management feature allows businesses to cluster and record client-specific characteristics and order history, ensuring a personalized approach to customer relations. In addition to delivering a one-size-fits-all solution for enterprise needs, Enterprise Cloud has industry-specific features that cater to the unique needs of target segments, such as construction and fashion. Its modular design allows enterprises to expand their solutions as they grow over time, making it an optimal tool for companies to run their daily business activities effectively and monitor their product development. With a value proposition that includes dedicated technical support for high-value customers and the ability to adapt to the evolving needs of growing businesses, Enterprise Cloud is a strategic solution for mid-sized companies looking to succeed in the digital era.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Digital Invoice
Subsubsection Text: Digital Invoice is the cornerstone of our ERP and FMS platforms and it is tailored to meet the key functional requirements of its users, providing an efficient, compliant and secure invoicing process. This mission-critical solution allows our customers to create, send, receive, register, sign and store electronic invoices from and to private customers, public administration organizations and external accountants and to send invoices and other documentation to the relevant tax authorities electronically. This product plays a pivotal role in the rapidly evolving digital landscape, offering a comprehensive, integrated approach to managing daily invoicing tasks. Digital Invoice is widely sold to our entire customer base and allows us to reach numerous digital customers connected through our accountant customers, as a result of the Italian Law No. 205 of December 27, 2017 (Legge _di Bilancio) which introduced the obligation for businesses in Italy with revenues higher than €65 thousand per_ year (with the exception of healthcare professionals) starting from January 1, 2019 to provide electronic invoices to other businesses with whom they conduct transactions and to file all the e-invoices directed to local and central public administrations. This requirement was expanded to include companies with revenue over €25 thousand from June 2022, with full adoption achieved in January 2024. Digital Invoice is a safe and end-to-end solution, handling the entire electronic invoice process from the upload of the invoice, the sending of the XML invoice to the Italian Revenue Agency’s exchange system (Sistema di _Interscambio–“SDI”) to the receipt of notifications. Digital Invoice facilitates both active and passive invoice_ filing and registration. It also features open application programming interfaces, allowing seamless integration with external applications, enhancing interoperability and functionality. Digital Invoice features an automatic dashboard that streamlines the process of receiving and generating invoices. This automation reduces manual intervention, thereby increasing efficiency and reducing errors. Furthermore, it supports standardized data flows, ensuring consistency and reliability in data management across various systems and applications. High levels of information and data sharing security are integral part to the solution, protecting sensitive financial data from breaches and unauthorized access. The platform offers simple queue and rejection management, making it userfriendly and accessible even for users with minimal technical expertise. By addressing the critical needs of businesses adapting to digital invoicing, Digital Invoice positions itself as an essential tool in a sector driven by digital transformation.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Digital Finance
Subsubsection Text: Digital Finance is a comprehensive suite of solutions designed to integrate financial value and supply chains, providing digital payment and credit services tailored to specific industry needs. By supporting end-to-end financial related needs, it enhances net working capital management and simplifies payment processes. Digital Finance offers simplified and integrated payment solutions for micro, small and medium-sized businesses (“SMBs”) and enterprises, facilitating bank statement reconciliation and complying with open banking standards, regulations and directives (e.g., PSD2 – AID, PIS). The platform includes artificial intelligence tools for rating and scoring that analyze deposited financial statements and ESG ratings, supporting informed financial decisions. Fintech solutions such as commercial credit factoring and e-lending are available to enhance cash management for both SMBs and larger enterprises. As an intermediary, we facilitate these services among customers and the relevant financial institutions. Seamless integration with our ERP and FMS software ensures seamless operation across various financial functions and possibility to obtain a fast pre-assessment service. The user-friendly ----- interface streamlines the financing process for all involved parties, while modular features allow for tailored rating solutions to meet specific customer requirements.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Extended CRM
Subsubsection Text: Our Extended Customer Relationship Management (“CRM”) solutions provide businesses, particularly mid-sized and micro businesses, with advanced tools for customer relationship management, marketing automation and ecommerce integration. This suite of tools is crafted to help clients scale their operations across multiple channels, enhancing their ability to serve their customer base effectively and increasing sales and conversion rates by implementing a multi-channel strategy. The CRM solution offers a versatile, modular platform that enhances the efficiency of sales efforts. It allows businesses to track client profiles and related leads comprehensively, making it easier to manage customer relationships and sales pipelines. The marketing automation component of our Extended CRM solutions add a layer of automation to marketing efforts. This component enables businesses to follow up with clients and generate leads through automated campaigns, ensuring continuous engagement and nurturing potential customers without manual intervention. In addition, the e-commerce integration supports every aspect of online sales, including user experience, shopping cart functionality and payment processing. This integration ensures a seamless e-commerce experience, driving higher conversion rates and customer satisfaction. Our Extended CRM offers modular solutions across a broad CRM spectrum, allowing businesses to customize their approach by selecting only the components they need, whether pure CRM functionalities or comprehensive market automation tools. Our suite supports the end-to-end digitalization of the sales process across various channels, including field sales, ensuring a streamlined and cohesive sales operation. Designed with an intuitive user experience in mind, the platform can be deployed either autonomously by the client or with the support of our internal team. As businesses grow, Extended CRM’s modular solutions can expand with them, ensuring that enterprises of all sizes can benefit from tailored CRM functionalities that meet their evolving needs. Additionally, the Extended CRM fully integrates with our ERP and FMS software, creating a unified and efficient business management ecosystem.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: HR Solutions
Subsubsection Text: HR Solutions provides an integrated suite of adaptable digital tools designed to assist micro-small companies, SMBs, large enterprises, accountants and labor consultants in efficiently managing payroll and human resources management. The platform offers a complete portfolio of solutions that address various aspects of HR management, ensuring a seamless and secure experience. HR Solutions features full integration with our ERP and FMS software, ensuring streamlined operations and data consistency. The platform guarantees the secure management of sensitive personnel data, adhering to advanced security protocols and a fully digital mobile app allows employees to track real-time data. The functional coverage of HR Solutions is extensive, encompassing human capital management, payroll, BPaaS and welfare. The product offerings streamline the recruiting process from position posting to profile collection and onboarding. The platform facilitates online training, creates learning paths and gathers satisfaction feedback to ensure continuous employee development. It manages healthcare requirements in compliance with industryspecific regulations and it includes performance compensation features for performance management, reviews and evaluations. Additionally, the welfare management module integrates with commercial partners to offer employees a range of benefits, such as health services, insurance and other welfare programs. This enhances employee satisfaction and loyalty by providing easy access to valuable support and benefits. On the employee administration side, our HR solutions track employee active workdays and they include automated pay slip issuance capabilities, with processing managed either in-house or outsourced. HR Solutions also leverages the Dipendenti in Cloud solution, which centralizes employee data to provide real-time access and management capabilities. This cloud-based approach ensures that all HR functions are seamlessly integrated, offering a unified approach to managing employee information. The use of BPaaS within HR Solutions allows businesses to outsource HR processes, focusing on core activities while benefiting from optimized and standardized HR operations.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Trust Services
Subsubsection Text: Our Trust services enable companies to fully digitize their operations while ensuring compliance with stringent regulatory standards. Our cornerstone Trust Services offering is our Digital Signature software that empowers ----- both companies and individuals to digitally sign documents. Our Digital Archive module enables the storage of documents across a business’s various arms, such as finance, legal and administration, in a secure archive. Supporting these offerings is our Trust services high standard of security for the storage of sensitive data, establishing a centralized repository that serves as a single point of access for digitally signed documents across an organization. In addition to digital signature and archiving capabilities, Trust services facilitate certified access via SPID, the Italian digital identity system that provides citizens and businesses with a single set of secure credentials to access various online services offered by Italian public administrations and private entities. To offer this service, our platform is fully integrated with our Trust services with external stakeholders, including Italian regulatory bodies such as the Italian Agency for a Digital Italy (Agenzia per l’Italia digitale). In addition, our solution is fully integrated within our portfolio, including Fatture in Cloud and Studio in Cloud. This integration extends to our ERP and FMS software, ensuring that businesses can maintain a cohesive and interoperable digital ecosystem.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Data and Artificial Intelligence
Subsubsection Text: We are actively advancing in the field of AI by expanding and enhancing our offering with new data-centric products, including aggregated data and benchmarking tools. At the start of 2024, we introduced an AI and automated accounting module designed to transform our software into a proactive and predictive tool, allowing it to manage routine and operational tasks. These and other newly developed AI tools currently support and strengthens our existing product suite, elevating the customer experience while increasing productivity. Catering to our customers’ needs, we have adopted AI features to enhance customer interaction and support through a first-generation AI virtual assistant designed to streamline customer service and engagement. This virtual assistant utilizes advanced AI algorithms to understand and respond to customer inquiries in real time, providing a seamless and intuitive experience for users. Complementing the virtual assistant is our customer assistant AI tool, which acts as a dedicated resource for customer support. This AI tool is equipped with machine learning capabilities that enable it to learn from interactions and improve its assistance over time. It provides customers with prompt and accurate responses, ensuring that their needs are met with efficiency and precision. We have enhanced our products within our Enterprise Solutions business unit by introducing an Invoice Insights feature, which utilizes advanced data analytics and AI to provide detailed insights into invoice patterns, payment behaviors and cash flow dynamics. Additionally, we have implemented a banks-to-invoice matching feature for both our Enterprise and Professional Solutions customers, which automates the reconciliation process between bank transactions and invoices, significantly reducing manual effort and errors and ensuring that financial records are accurate. This automation frees up valuable time for our customers, allowing them to focus on more strategic tasks. Customers in our Professional Solutions and Micro Solutions business units also benefit from AI assistants that enable faster and simplified use of software such as Fatture in Cloud, Studio Cloud and our Enterprise Cloud products.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our Sales Channels
Subsubsection Text: Our Field Sales Channel provides capillary and extensive geographical coverage through direct and indirect “on field” salesforce, providing software solutions and related services, including installation, start-up, maintenance and post-sale customer assistance, directly to our customers. _Direct Salesforce_ Our direct “on field” salesforce sells our products mainly to our SME and professional end-customers. As of March 31, 2024, our sales team was composed of approximately 230 in-house on-field representatives, distributed throughout our main locations spread across Italy. In addition, as of March 31, 2024, approximately 11 ACG agencies. The ACG agencies, which are not VARs, resell certain of our Enterprise Solutions products, provide software installation services directly to our customers and are remunerated on the basis of a percentage of their sales to our customers. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, approximately 2% of our total revenue was generated by ACG agencies. ----- Our sales representatives are employed directly by us while our sales agents operate under exclusive agency contracts, which ensure that their activities are aligned with our objectives and goals, through targets levels, reporting, marketing guidelines, training and pricing policies. In addition, as of March 31, 2024, we had a dedicated team of 16 sales specialists selling, via phone or through our e-commerce website, our Micro and Small Solutions and extended CRM product offering (our “Digital Sales Team”). _Indirect Salesforce_ Our indirect salesforce is mainly composed of our VAR network. VARs resell our products and are mainly focused on professional and mid-sized companies. VARs sell on behalf of ERP software providers and usually operate on an exclusive basis with a single provider. VARs install the relevant software and provide assistance and software maintenance services to customers. The provision of these business services is particularly important to micro and small business and professionals, who do not usually have the necessary in‑house capabilities to efficiently install and maintain a new software system or the ability to train staff in using such new software. In the past, VARs have been key to ensure close customer relationships, enabling us to deliver tailored services, market our products effectively and reach a wider customer base while optimizing commercial costs. However, digital solution adoption and new sales drives, including enhanced reliance on high recurring revenues as well as the industry-wide shift towards SaaS technologies has lessened the necessity for an extensive indirect network, as the breadth of commercial coverage and the need for service proximity become less critical. As a result, we embarked on a VAR transformation program in 2018 to transition from an extensive VAR network to a more streamlined, insourced model. The VAR insourcing initiative is designed to streamline our sales approach and enhance profitability by embedding the insourcing margin directly into our direct salesforce segment, demonstrating our commitment to optimizing our sales channel mix and driving sustained growth through strategic insourcing. In the twelve months ended March 31, 2024, we successfully integrated more than 20 VARs. The program promotes a sell-out-based model to drive business growth and align commercial practices with incentives that encourage sell-out activities. The initiative aims to increase VARs’ coverage size to develop economies of scale and enhance the effectiveness of sales. This process also involves increasing the number of VARs in high-potential geographies, with the goal of establishing a network of selected large VARs to cover low-potential geographies, ensuring full alignment of commercial strategy and sales effectiveness with the direct salesforce. The VAR insourcing initiative has led to an increase in sales productivity by leveraging our best practices, such as incentives and tools. The initiative has also accelerated the penetration of cloud products and expanded our new offering to acquired customers through cross-selling. Financial benefits have been realized from integration, increasing efficiency in customer support, delivery and general and administrative functions. Moreover, the insourcing margin has been embedded into the direct salesforce channel, improving profitability. A prime example of the success of this initiative is the acquisition and subsequent integration of Progetto Studio, which was our largest VAR. Acquired at the end of 2021, Progetto Studio is now managed directly by us as a stand-alone entity, demonstrating our commitment to optimizing our sales channel mix and driving growth through strategic insourcing. The strategic shift has significantly reshaped our sales structure, leading to a reduction in the revenue contribution of our indirect salesforce, which has reduced from 24.5% in 2020 to 13.0% by 2023. As of March 31, 2024, our indirect salesforce included over 100 VARs, which are located and service customers throughout Italy. See “Risk _Factors—Risks related to our business—If we fail to maintain, expand or develop our relationships with VARs and ACG agencies, we could lose a significant portion of our end‑customers, which could have a negative impact on our business and financial conditions” and “Risk Factors—Risks related to our business—Changes to our sales organization and other corporate functions harm our business and may negatively impact our results of operations.”_

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our Sales Channels
Subsubsection Text: Our Online Sales Channel represents a dynamic and rapidly growing segment of our overall sales strategy, serving as an alternative to the Field Sales Channel. While it is available to a diverse customer profile of micro and small businesses, mid-market customers and professionals, the Online Sales Channel has been developed to provide a scalable and user-friendly sales experience, particularly suited to simple and standardized products that do not require a high degree of customization. ----- Revenue from this channel has increased at an average of approximately 15% between 2019 and 2023. This indicates a strong and consistent expansion of online sales, which can be attributed to several strategic initiatives and investments. One of the key performance indicators that underscore the performance of the online channel is the long-term value to customer acquisition cost ratio. This metric, which measures the lifetime value of a customer against the cost of acquiring them, demonstrated a significant return for our top online products in 2022, namely, Fatture in Cloud, Contabilità in Cloud and CRM in Cloud, for which the ratio exceeded a multiple of 5. This ratio demonstrates the efficiency and effectiveness of the online marketing and sales processes, highlighting the channel’s ability to attract and retain valuable customers at a relatively low cost. Marketing efforts have been increased to support the Online Sales Channel’s growth, with marketing spend as a percentage of the channel’s revenue increasing over time. This investment in marketing has been instrumental in driving traffic to our website and converting visitors into customers. The channel’s visibility index has also seen a significant uptick, mirroring our incumbent position in the Italian segment. The Online Sales Channel’s performance is further bolstered by its scalability and the lean and intuitive sales process that it delivers. This approach has made it easier for customers to complete the purchase process, from product discovery to final transaction. The channel’s scalability ensures that we can efficiently manage a growing volume of transactions without a proportional increase in salesforce or support staff. As digitalization continues to shape consumer behavior and business operations, the Online Sales Channel is well-equipped to capitalize on these trends and continue its upward trajectory.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Our Sales Channels
Subsubsection Text: Our Accountants Sales Channel benefit from the relationships that accountants have with their clients, particularly with micro and small businesses. As financial advisors and intermediaries to their clients, accountants can recommend solutions that improve the efficiency and compliance of their clients’ business. We incentivize accountants to introduce clients to our solutions through three key benefits: the ease of integrating and managing customer data with our software, the ability to resell solutions like Digital Invoice at a discounted rate from us and referral awards for new leads that convert into our customers. Recognizing the critical role that sales channels play in boosting revenue and expanding our customer base, especially in the Micro and Small Business segment, we launched a program in 2022 that provides professionals with opportunities for profit-sharing (through rebates based on the sales of our software that they generate), specialized support and access to a credit platform. This initiative is tailored for professional firms looking to grow and benefit from the opportunities afforded by digital transformation.
